Caster may apply his directed spell skill (Waterbolt) to only one of the attacks (the others get a +0 OB)

The area of effect for this spell is the water immediately surrounding the boat that the caster is on. For as long as the caster concentrates, the speed of the boat can be increased by 50' per round (approximately 3 miles per hour).
As Calm Water, except waves are cut by 50' in center and caster need not concentrate.
Creates a 50' whirlpool that will draw in any unpowered object within 500' (takes 2 minutes of concentration to start). Powered objects may make manuever rolls to resist the pull of the whirlpool.
Caster can part water up to 100' deep and 100' per level long and 10' wide at bottom (50' at top).

Summons forces of nature in a fierce sea storm (must be created over a large body of water). This storm will include waves of 20-50', heavy rain, and winds of 25-60 mph. The storm can be delayed up to 1 hour per level. After the storm is summoned, it will dissipate normally.
Caster can use one lower level spell (on this list) each round.

Special Notes: All vacuums created by spells on this list also create a loud noise. The larger the radius, the louder the noise. The GM may wish to rule that all within the radius must make a second RR or be deafened for 1 round per 10 failure (RR attack level equals the radius of the vacuum).
All walls creatured by spells on this list must rest on a solid surface. See Section 7.1.7 for more information on walls (and spell effects on walls).

An elemental creature made of gas will be cut to 20\% activity if it is the target of an Air Stop spell (and the creature fits into the area of effect). A Vacuum spell thrown upon an elemental creature made of gas will result in a Slaying critical on the creature. A Whirlwind has no effect
on an elemental creature made of gas.

Spells.Description: Causes a light breeze (up to 20' per round) as long as the caster concentrates. Any gasses in the area are moved by the breeze.
Creates a wall of dense churning air up to 10' x 10' x 3'. This wall reduces all movement through it by 50\%. In addition, all attacks through the wall suffer a -50 penalty.

By concentrating, the caster can remove most of the oxygen from the area of effect. After three rounds of concentration, all targets in the area of effect must make an RR each round in the area of effect or fall asleep (1 round per 10 failure). All fire spells in the area suffers a -20 penalty (or are 20\% less effective in the case of non-attack spells).

Creates a 5'R cloud of charged gas particles. This cloud delivers a 'C' Electricity critical to all within the area of effect on the first and second rounds; a 'B' on the third and fourth rounds; and an 'A' on the fifth and sixth rounds (after 6 rounds, the cloud dissi- pates). This cloud drifts with the wind. The cloud takes one round to form (so anyone in the radius when it is cast may make a maneuver to move out of the radius without taking a critical). It will then stayed formed for six rounds.
Stops all generalized air movement (e.g., wind) up to winds of 30 mph; cuts stronger winds by 30 mph in the area of effect.
As Stun Cloud I, except radius is 10'.
Creates a 5'R near vacuum. Anyone inside the radius must make a successful RR or take a 'B' Impact critical, as air leaves and rushes back in.
As Air Stop I, except radius is 20'.
As Slumber Mist, except for the duration, and it drifts with the wind.
As Stun Cloud V, except radius is 20'.
As Stun Cloud I, except delivers an 'E' on rounds 1 and 2, a 'D' on rounds 3 and 4, a 'C' on rounds 5 and 6, a 'B' on rounds 7 and 8, and an 'A' on rounds 9 and 10.
As Vacuum I, except radius is 10'.
As Air Stop I, except radius is 100'.

A 10'R whirlwind is created. This whirlwind delivers an 'A' Impact critical to all inside (every round). All movement through or within the whirlwind is reduced by 80\%. The caster can move the whirlwind 1' per round.
As Death Cloud I, except radius is 10'.
As Vacuum I, except radius is 20'.
As Vacuum I, except delivers a 'D' Impact critical.
As Stun Cloud IV, except by concentrating the caster can move it 10' per round up to 100' away.
Allows the caster to change the direction of the wind within the radius.
Caster must outstretch arms and then a hard wind comes forth from them, fanning out till it has a 25'R at 300'. All within the cone receive a 'B' Impact critical.

Summons forces of nature in a fierce thunder- storm. This storm will include heavy rain, 25-60 mph winds, lightning (random), and a blizzard (if correct climate). The storm can be delayed for up to 1 hour per level of the caster.
Caster can use one lower level spell (on this list) each round.

When the caster of this spell is a target of a spell from the realm of Essence, the ''incoming'' spell must first make an RR before the caster makes an RR. For RR purposes, each spell uses a level equal to the level of its caster. If the ''incoming'' spell passes the RR, it may target the caster normally; otherwise, the incoming spell has no effect on this target.
As Cancel Essence I, except affects spells from the realm of Mentalism.
As Cancel Essence I, except affects spells from the realm of Channeling.
Any active spell from the realm of Essence that is on the target must make are RR (use the level of that spell's caster as the spells level). If the spell fails its RR, it is dispelled.
As Dispel Essence I, except affects spells from the realm of Mentalism.
As Dispel Essence I, except affects spells from the realm of Channeling.

As Dispel Essence I, except for the area of effect (centered on the caster). If the radius encounters an already existing spell, the spell must make an RR (with a +30 modifier) or be cancelled (not dispelled) for as long as the active spell in inside the radius.
As Dispel Essence Sphere I, except only Mentalism spells are affected.
As Dispel Essence Sphere I, except only Channeling spells are affected.
As Dispel Essence Sphere I, except radius is 50'.
As Dispel Mentalism Sphere I, except radius is 50'.
As Dispel Channeling Sphere I, except radius is 50'.
As Dispel Essence Sphere I, except radius is 100'.
As Dispel Mentalism Sphere I, except radius is 100'.
As Dispel Mentalism Sphere I, except radius is 100'.

Target has no Essence power points (and thus can throw no Essence spells) for 24 hours (this includes spells cast using spell bonus items). This can also be cast against items which could normally cast spells. Hybrid spell casters who have Essence as one of their realms only have access to half their normal power points.
As Unessence, except Mentalism is affected.
As Unessence, except Channeling is af- fected.
As Cancel Essence I except all 3 realms are affected.
As Dispel Essence Sphere I, except radius is 300'.
As Dispel Essence I, except all 3 realms are affected.
As Dispel Essence Sphere V, except all 3 realms are affected.

Special Notes: See Section 7.1.31 for more on summoning cretures and controlling demons.

Spells.Description: The caster can attune himself to a small creature (of creature intelligence) to serve as his familiar. The caster must obtain the creature through normal means (can be no more than 10\% of caster's own mass) and cast this spell on the creature once per day for 1 week (concentrating for 2 hours per day). The caster can then control the familiar and view the world through its senses by concentrating on it (though the familiar must be within 50' per level). If the creature is killed, the caster will have a -25 modification to all actions for 2 weeks.

Caster can instantly summon a first level, non- intelligent creature that he can control. If the creature can understand the caster's communication (e.g., Creature Tongues), the creature can be controlled by normal communication. Oth- erwise, control is only maintained through concentration of the caster. The general type of the creature can be specified by the caster but exactly what the creature is should be determined by the GM (selected from creatures commonly found in the area where the spell is cast). If the creature was summoned to be used for a task that is not dangerous to the creature, the duration for this spell is 10 minutes per level of the caster. However, if the creature is ever put into a dangerous situation, the duration drops to 1 round per level of the caster.

The caster can make a semi-intelligent being a companion. The companion can be no more than 50\% of the caster's mass. The companion cannot be more intelligent than the caster. The relationship between the caster and the compan- ion is not magical (and the caster must strive to maintain good relations with the companion or it will leave him). The relation- ship should be treated as a parent/child relationship. The com- panion will almost always obey a ''do not'' command (e.g., ''Do not drink that potion''); but the companion may make an RR to resist a ''do'' command (e.g., ''Go steal the eggs from the chickens). The GM should determine when a command is a ''do not'' command and when a command is a ''do'' command (i.e., the commands do not have to have ''do'' or ''do not'' in them�it is the intent of the command that should be exam- ined).

As Summons I, except caster can also choose one of the following options: a) the level of a sum- moned creature is increased by one, b) an extra first level creature can be summoned, or c) the duration can be doubled.
Allows the caster to control a Type I demon for the duration of the spell. At the time of casting, there is a 2\% chance per Type of the demon that the demon can ignore the control.
As Summons II, except 2 options can be chosen.

Caster summons a demon who gradually appears over the course of d10+1 rounds. The GM should roll d100 (not open-ended) to determine the type of the demon. A result of 1-60 summons a Type I demon. A result of 61-90 summons a Type II demon. A result of 91-100 summons a Type III demon. See Section 7.1.31 for results if demon is not ''controlled'' or ''mastered'' before it fully appears.
As Summons III, except 4 options can be chosen.
As Control Demon I, except Type I and Type II demons can be controlled.
As Summons III, except 9 options can be chosen.

After casting this spell, any nearby rural spirits or occupational spirits will visit the caster (exact time before the visit occurs may vary). The summoned folk will have the same nature as the caster. The exact results of their visit will vary (GM's discretion).
As Control Demon I, except Type I, Type II, and Type III demons can be controlled.
As Companion, except there is no size limitation on the companion.

As Summons X, except the arrival of the summoned creature(s) can be delayed up to 1 day per level of the caster or until triggered by one of the following (decided at the time of casting): specified movements, touch, or a specific action. The caster may specify (at the time of casting) a single task for the creature(s) to perform when it (they) arrives.
As Summons III, except 19 options may be chosen.
As Waiting Summons, except it functions as Lesser Demonic Gate.

As Lesser Demonic Gate, except Types III, IV, V, and VI can be summoned. Roll d100 (not open- ended) to determine the type: 1-60 results in a Type III demon, 61-85 results in a Type IV demon, 86-95 results in a Type V demon, and 96-100 results in a Type VI demon.
As Control Demon I, except Type I, Type II, Type III, and Type IV demons can be controlled.
As Summons III, except the caster can take as many options as he has levels.
As Control Demon II, except concen- tration is not required. There is a 5\% chance per Type of the demon that the demon can ignore the mastery.
As Waiting Summons, except it functions as Greater Demonic Gate.
As Control Demon I, except Type I, Type II, Type III, Type IV, and Type V demons can be controlled.

Special Notes: See Section 7.1.10 for more in invisibility (including effects of invisibility and how to detect it).

Spells.Description: A single object is made invisible (1 garment, 1 naked body, etc.); until 24 hrs pass or the object is struck by a violent blow (being hit by a weapon, falling, etc.) or the object makes a violent move (i.e., an attack).
As Unseen I, except everything within 1' of the target is invisible as long as it is within 1' and none of the Unseen I termination conditions occur. See Section 7.1.10.
As Invisibility I, except the radius can vary up to 1' (chosen at the time of casting). This makes the invisible target harder to see. See Section 7.1.10.
As Invisibility I, except the radius is 10'.
As Unseen I, except 3 objects can be affected.
As Invisibility Sphere I, except the radius can vary up to 10' (chosen at the time of casting).
As Unseen I, except 5 objects can be affected.
As Invisibility I, except two targets can be affected (with a separate radius for each).
As Unseen I, except up to 10 objects can be affected.
As Invisibility Split Sphere, except the two radii can vary up to 10' (chosen at the time of casting).
As Invisibility I, except radius can vary up to 20' (chosen at the time of casting).
As Unseen I, except as many objects as the caster's level may be affected.
As Invisibility I, except as many targets as the caster's level can be affected. Each target gets its own radius.
As Invisibility II, except only affects the caster. If he attacks he is only visible for the round immediately following the attack. Violent blows do not affect this spell.

Special Notes: See Section 7.1.11 for more on the abilities gained/retained when a new shape is assumed.

Spells.Description: Caster may shrink by up to 50\% his normal mass (height in most situations). The caster retains his previous strength.
As Shrink Self, except caster may increase his mass by 50\% (height in most situations); there is no increase in his strength (except for movement purposes).
Allows caster to analyze the form of another being for future use with True Change.

Caster can alter the target's form to the form of any desired humanoid race. The form cannot be a specific form. For example, the target could take on the form of a Dwarf, but not the Dwarven king. Only physical form is gained (e.g., the target who becomes a Dwarf would not receive the dwarves ability to see in the dark). See Section 7.1.11.
As Shrink Self, except the maximum decrease is 10\% of caster's mass per level (maximum of 90\% of the target's mass) and it can be cast on any material that is living or was once living.
As Shrink, except it increases target's mass up to 10\% of caster's mass per level.
As Change to Kind, except alteration can be to any organic form within 50\% to 200\% target's current mass. Target gains no special abilities from the change.
As Change, except altered form can be that of a specific being analyzed by Change Lore.
As True Change, except caster may assume a different form anytime during the spell, by concentrating for one round per change.

Target can merge into any solid, inanimate material. While merged, the target cannot move or perceive. When the target emerges from the material, he can emerge from any side or face of the material. The target cannot move ''through'' material greater in width than his own body size plus 2 feet. The caster can exit at any time up to 1 hr/lvl; all other targets must emerge after a specified time (the caster specifies the time when the spell is cast, must be less than 1 hr/lvl).
Target has all critical hits lowered by one in severity (an 'A' critical is treated as an 'A' critical with a -20 modification).
Target may pass through any inani- mate material up to 1' per level; it takes one round to pass through 2'.
As Enlarge, except it simul- taneously enlarges (by up to 50\% of caster's mass) as many targets as the caster's level. All objects must enlarge the same percentage amount.
As Change, except affects up to the caster's level in targets (all targets must take the same type of form).

As Merging, except affects up to the caster's level in targets. All targets must exit after a set time. If the caster is one of the targets, he may exit ant any time and all other targets can exit with him.

Special Notes: See Section 7.1.12 for notes on encumbrance limits for the spells on this list.

Spells.Description: Allows the target to leap 50' laterally or 20' vertically in the round that the spell is cast.
Allows the tar- get to land safely after a fall up to 20' per level of the caster. In addition, the target may take that distance off the severity of any longer fall.

Caster teleports the target to a point up to 100' away. There can be no intervening ''barriers'' in a direct line between the target and the point. A ''barrier'' is de- fined as anything the target could not physically go through (e.g., a closed door is a barrier, a pit is not).
Allows target to move up and down verti- cally at a rate of 10' per round. The spell does not confer any ability to control horizontal movement.
Target can fly at a rate of 75' per round (approxi- mately 5 mph). While Fly is active, normal movement (e.g., walking, running, etc.) is not allowed.

Opens a 3'x6'x3' portal in any solid surface. At the end of the duration, the surface is returned to its previous state. If anyone is in the area of effect when the spell effect ends, he is forced back to his point of entry
As Fly I, except rate is 150' per round.

As Leaving I, except target can pass through barriers by specifying exact distances. If the arrival point coincides with solid or liquid material, the target does not move; instead, he is stunned 1-10 rounds (the caster still expends the PPs for this spell).
As Leaving I, except movement range is 300'.

As Long Door I, except movement range is 10 miles per level. This can be very risky depending upon the caster's familiarity with the destination's locale. The following chances for failure exist: Never seen place (but has had de- scribed) = 50\%; Been briefly (one hour or less) = 25\%; Studied (been in for 24 hours) = 10\%; Studied carefully (7 days) = 1\%; Lived in (for at least one year) = .01\%. In the case of failure, first determine the direction of the error (randomly). The amount of error is then determined by making a d100 (open-ended) to determine the distance of the error in feet.
As Fly I, except rate is 300' per round.
As Long Door I, except movement range is 300'.
As Teleport I, except up to 3 targets may be moved to same place.
As Portal, except portal is 3'x6' and up to 5' per level deep.
As Long Door I, except movement range is 500'.
As Teleport III, except 5 targets may be moved.
As Fly I, except rate is 450' per round.
As Teleport III, except 10 targets may be moved.
As Leaving, except as many targets as the caster's level may be moved.
As Teleport III, except 20 targets can be moved.
As Long Door, except as many targets as the caster's level may be moved up to 300'.
As Teleport III, except as many targets as the caster's level may be moved.
As Teleport I, except with an unlimited movement range.

Special Notes: See 7.1.24 for more information on Haste and Speed.

Spells.Description: Target may run at double his normal walking pace; he expends exhaustion points at the same rate he would if he were walking, once he stops or performs some other action the spell is canceled.

Target may act at twice his normal rate (i.e., 200\% activity per round), but immediately afterwards must spend a number of rounds equal to the rounds speeded at half rate (i.e., only 50\% normal activity per round). See 7.1.24 for more information.
Target reads at a rate of 10 pages per minute.
As Speed I, except duration is 2 rounds for one target or 1 round for each of 2 targets.
Target may run at triple his normal walking pace and only expends exhaustion points at the same rate he would if he were walking. Once he stops or performs some other action the spell is canceled.
Target may act at twice his normal rate (i.e., 200\% activity). See Section 7.1.24 for more information.
As Speed I, except duration is 3 rounds split among one to three targets (in any combination).
s Haste I, except duration is 2 rounds for one target or 1 round for each of 2 targets.

Target may run at four times his normal walking pace and only expend exhaustion points at the same rate he would if he were walking, but once he stops or performs some other action the spell is canceled.
As Speed III, except duration is 5 rounds split among one to five targets (in any combination).
As Run I, except 3 targets may be affected.
As Haste I, except duration is 3 rounds split among one to three targets (in any combination).
As Sprint I, except 3 targets may be affected.
As Haste III, except duration is 5 rounds split among one to five targets (in any combination).
As Run I, except 5 targets may be affected.
As Speed III, except duration is 10 rounds split among one to ten targets (in any combination).
As Sprint I, except 5 targets may be affected.
As Haste III, except duration is 10 rounds split among one to ten targets (in any combination).
As Run I, except as many targets as the caster's level may be affected.
As Speed III, except duration is a number of rounds equal to the caster's level, split among any number of targets up to the caster's level (in any combination).
As Haste III, except duration is a number of rounds equal to the caster's level, split among any number of targets up to the caster's level (in any combination).

Special Notes: When casting a spell that can affect multiple targets, the caster can concentrate in order to hold the spell until it can be applied to the allowed number of targets.
The bonuses from Enchanted Robes and Enchanted Leather are not cumulative and they are not cumulative with bonuses from other armor.

Spells.Description: Caster temporarily enchants a nonmagic, non-metal shield with a +10 Defensive Bonus (DB).

Creates an invisible force shield in front of the caster. This functions as a normal shield (subtracting 25 from appropriate attacks, etc.), except it does not occupy a hand. This spell cannot be combined with a ''real'' shield.
Causes target to appear blurred to attackers. This subtracts 10 from all attacks.
Caster temporarily enchants one robe to confer a +10 DB.
Caster can deflect any one missile that passes within 100' of him (caster must be able to see the missile). This causes 100 to be subtracted from the missile's attack.
Caster temporarily enchants one nonmagic suit of leather (usually a shirt) with a +10 DB.
Caster can deflect any one melee attack that he can see (and is within range). This causes 50 to be subtracted from the attack.
As Deflections I, except 2 missiles may be affected.
Caster can deflect any one missile that passes within 100' of him (caster must be able to see the missile). This causes the missile to automatically miss its target.
As Bladeturn I, except 2 melee attacks may be affected.
As Deflections I, except 3 missiles may be affected.
As Aim Untrue I, except 2 missiles may be affected.
As Bladeturn I, except 3 melee attacks may be affected.
One missile passing within 100' of caster is reversed and make an attack on its source. For the attack on the missile's source, use an OB of +5 (no other OB or DB modifiers apply).
As Aim Untrue I, except 3 missiles may be affected.
As Deflections I, except as many missiles as the caster's level may be affected.
As Bladeturn I, except as many melee attacks as the caster's level may be affected.
As Mass Deflections, except missiles automatically miss.
As Re-aiming, except all missiles passing within 100' of caster are reversed. Each missile attacks its firer with a +20 OB.

Special Notes: Only spells with a defined duration can have their duration changed with an Extension spell. This does not include spells with a duration of ''concentration'' or ''instant'' spells.
Only spells with a ''radius'' effect can have their area of effect changed by the Increase Radius spells.
Only spells with a range other than ''self'' can be affected by Ranging spells.
Instant Ranging does not allow two spells to be cast in the same round. Thus, a spell that is utilizing Instant Ranging still takes a minimum of two rounds to cast

Spells.Description: Caster can add a minor smell, visual, or audio aspect to the next spell that he casts. This minor effect cannot increase or change the effects of the spell in any fashion.
Causes the next spell that the caster casts (within 1 minute) to have double the normal duration. This spell is not cumulative with any other Extension spells.
Causes the next spell that the caster casts (within 1 minute) to have its range increased by 50'. This spell is not cumulative with any other Ranging spells.
As Extension II, except duration is 3 times normal.
As Ranging I, except the casting time is instant.
Causes the next spell that the caster casts (within 1 minute) to have its area of effect increased by 5'. This spell is not cumulative with other Increased Radius spells.
As Ranging I, except range increase is 100'.
As Extension II, except duration is 4 times normal.
As Instant Ranging I, except range is increased by 100'.
As Increased Radius I, except area of effect is increased by 10'.
As Ranging I, except range increase is 200'.
As Extension II, except duration is 5 times normal.
As Instant Ranging I, except range is increased by 200'.
As Increased Radius I, except area of effect is increased by 15'.
As Ranging I, except range increase is 300'.
As Extension II, except duration is 10 times normal.
As Instant Ranging I, except range is increased by 300'.
As Increased Radius II, except area of effect is increased by 20'.
As Ranging I, except range increase is 500'.
As Extension II, except duration is increased by 12 hours.
As Extension II, except duration is increased by 24 hours.
As Extension II, except duration is permanent. Only one permanent spell can be in effect at a time for each spell caster.

Caster may cast this spell with any spell he wants to store. The spell to be stored must be cast within one minute after the Spell Store is cast. The stored spell may then be cast later as an instantaneous spell. The Spell Store costs the same number of PPs as the spell that is stored. No other spell may be cast while a spell is stored
If the target of this spell is casting a spell, the caster will know what realm the spell is from and what type of spell the target is casting.

The attack spell that is targeted with this spell must make an RR (using its caster's level as its level). If the RR succeeds, it will attack its original target as intended; otherwise, the effects of that spell are delayed for the duration of this spell. At the end of the duration, if the target of the held spell has moved more than 20', the held spell may randomly affect another target within 10' of the original target point. Base attack spells will suffer a -20 modification if not cast upon the original target. Elemental attack spell suffer a -30 modification if not cast upon the original target.

Caster can deflect 1 elemental attack spell. The incoming spell must make an RR (using its caster's level as its level). If the RR succeeds, it will attack its target normally; otherwise, its attack roll is modified by -10 per 10 failure.
As Spell Hold I, except attack spells can be held up to 2 rounds.
As Spell Bending I, except attack roll is modified by -20 per 10 failure.
As Spell Hold I, except attack spells can be held up to 3 rounds.

The target elemental attack spell must make an RR (using its caster's level as its level) with a modification of +20 (in favor of the elemental attack spell). If the RR suceeds, it makes its attack as normal; otherwise, the elemental attack spell is reversed back on its caster. Resolve the attack with only a +0 OB.
As Spell Bending I, except attack roll is modified by -30 per 10 failure.
As Spell Hold I, except attack spells can be held up to 4 rounds.

The caster may ''borrow'' power points from the days to come. When this spell is cast, the caster regain all of his power points (up to his maximum). The PP cost for casting this spell may come from the ''borrowed'' PPs. Every time the caster casts this spell, he looses all PPs for the next two days (the normal duration of this spell). He also takes hits equal to 10\% of his normal maximum hits. In addition, for the duration of this spell, he will cast spells as if he were one level lower than he actually is. This spell may be cast multiple times (borrowing PPs from many days to come), but all the effects are cumulative. For example, if cast twice, the caster will lose all PPs for the next 4 days, take 20\% of his hits, and cast spells at 2 levels lower than normal. All penalties will remain in effect until the duration of the spell lapses. At the end of this spell's duration, the caster must sleep for a consecutive 10 hours for each time this spell was cast.
As Spell Bending I, except attack roll is modified by -40 per 10 failure.
As Spell Hold I, except attack spell is held up to 5 rounds.
As Reverse Spell I, except use an OB equal to half the original OB.
As Spell Bending I, except attack roll is modified by -50 per 10 failure.
As Spell Hold I, except attack spell is held up to 10 rounds.
As Spell Hold I, except attack spell is held for up to 20 rounds.
As Spell Bending I, except spell can be deflected up to 90 degree in any direction (caster of this spell may designate another target for the spell, use half of his appropriate OB).
As Spell Hold I, except attack spell is held up to 1 round per level.
As Reverse Spells, except all spells within a 100'R of the caster are reversed.

Special Notes: Great spirits have always encountered violent opposition from mediocre minds.

Spells.Description: Causes target(s) to fall into a natural sleep. This spell can affect a number of targets whose levels total up to 5. The caster must be able to see all the targets. At the time of casting, the caster should designate target priority (i.e., affect target A; if levels are left, affect target B; etc.). The first 2 rounds of sleep are magical (the target cannot be awakened through normal means).
Target humanoid believes the caster is a good friend.
As Sleep V, except a total of 7 levels can be affected.
Target is incapable of making decisions or initiating action. However, the target may continue to fight if already engaged; he may also fight in self defense.
Target will follow a single suggested act that is not completely alien to him (e.g., no suicide suggestions, no blinding himself suggestions, etc.).
As Sleep V, except a total of 10 levels may be affected.
Target humanoid is held to 25\% activity per round.
Target humanoid must obey caster. However, he will not perform any act that is completely alien to him (e.g., no suicide suggestions, no blinding himself, etc.).
As Sleep V, except a total of 20 levels may be affected.
As Charm Kind, except any sentient creature may be affected.

Target is given one task, failure results in a penalty determined by the Gamemaster (task must be within capabilities of target). If the target ignores the quest, he will suffer the same effects as for failure.
(RR Mod: -10) Target is stunned for 1 round per 10 failure.
(RR Mod: -10) As Word of Stunning, except target takes 50\% of remaining concussion hits upon failure.
As Hold Kind, except any sentient being can be affected.
(RR Mod: -10) As Word of Stunning, except target falls into a natural sleep. The first minute of sleep is magical; the target cannot be awakened through normal means.
(RR Mod: -10) As Word of Stunning, except target will not cooperate or agree with anyone for 1 day per 10 failure.

(RR Mod: -10) Target is forced to come and face the caster (fighting to get there if necessary). Once he faces the caster, he must remain immobile for 1 round per 10 failure. For the duration of this spell, the caster must remain immobile, or the spell is dispelled.
(RR Mod: -10) Any of the ''Words'' above can be set to go off at a specified time or if there is movement within a designated 10'R.
(RR Mod: -10) Target suffers the results of an 'E' critical strike; the caster chooses the critical type.
As Quest, except failure is punished by the target suffering five 'E' critical strikes (choose which critical types randomly).

(RR Mod: -10) As Word of Stunning, except any three different ''Words'' may be used on the same round (a separate RR roll must be made for each one). If all three words are the same, and all three RR's fail, the effect is permanent.
(RR Mod: -10) As Word of Stunning, except any ''Word'' may be used and it will affect a number of levels equal to the level of the caster (as Sleep).
Caster can use one spell/rnd on this list (10th level or lower).

Special Notes: When using Guess, the caster must have a limited number of options (i.e., finite and countable). After the spell is caster, the caster may not cast another Guess for the same information until his experience level has increased (See Section 7.1.4).

When dealing with Dreams, the GM may should use lots of symbology. Do not reveal straight forward answers. For example, if the character would like to know if someone in the party is going to betray them; the dream could be about an apple farmer who gathered all his apples across the season, only to discover that the barrel he was using to store them in had rotted through the bottom and he would be unable to carry his crop to town. See Section 7.1.22.

Spells.Description: Caster can attempt to avoid one missile shot fired at him. The missile must be in his field of vision when the spell is cast. The caster gets a bonus of +50 to his DB against this attack.
As Anticipate Missile, except applies to one melee attack that the caster is aware of.

When faced with a choice about which he has little or no information (e.g., which corridor leads outside the quick- est) the caster may cast this spell and the Gamemaster will determine which way he goes, biasing the choice favorable by 25\% (e.g, roll 1-100: correct on 26-100, incorrect on 01-25).

Caster can avoid one spell cast on him. The caster gets a bonus of +50 to his DB against a directed elemental attack; his normal DB against an area elemental attack; or the caster�s BAR suffers a -10 penalty (on all other spell attacks).
Caster gains a vision of what will probably happen in the next minute if he takes a specified action.

Caster is aware of any being within the area of effect that has hostile intentions towards him. The hostility must be directed specifically at the caster or the spell reveals nothing. The being�s hostility must be active (i.e., driving the being to perform aggressive actions), not passive (i.e., hate exists, but no action is planned).
Caster has a dream relating to a topic decided upon just before retiring. This spell can only be used once per night. The caster must sleep a minimum of one normal sleep cycle.
Caster has a vision of what has occurred in a room or place; limited to up to 1 minute per level into the past. The size of the room is limited to the area of effect.

Predicts most probable actions of a being in the next round; specifics are not learned (e.g., attack in melee, cast a spell; but no detail on attack target or what spell). This results in the caster being able to declare his statement of intent for the round after hearing what the target has decided to do. Note that the target is free to change his declared action with the requisite penalties.
As Intuitions I, except caster gets to gaze 2 minutes into the future.
As Room Feel I, except limit is 1 hr/lvl.
As Anticipate Hostility, except for area of effect, duration and range.
As Dream I, except limit is 2 dreams/night on different topics.
As Anticipations, except if action is to cast a spell, the spell to be cast and target are learned.
As Room Feel I, except limit is 1 day/lvl.
As Dream I, except limit is 3 dreams/night on different topics.
As Room Feel I, except limit is 1 week/ lvl.
As Intuitions I, except time limit extends 1 min/lvl into the future.
As Anticipations, except caster can predict actions of all beings within 100' of him.
As Dream I, except limit is 5 dreams/night on any combination of topics the caster chooses.
As Anticipations True, except spell types and targets are learned.

Special Notes: You may delay, but time will not.

Spells.Description: Caster can read text written in an unknown language, but only understand basic concepts of it. This spell gives the caster the equivalent of rank 2 knowledge in a written language.
Gives nature and origin of natural stone, and when and how worked stone was obtained and worked.
As Stone Analysis, except metal may be examined.
As Stone Analysis, except gas may be examined.

As Text Analysis I, except gives a complete technical analysis (vocabulary and syntax) but not an understanding of idioms (jargon), implications, or cultural references.This spell gives the caster the equivalent of rank 5 knowledge in a written language.
As Stone Analysis, except liquid may be examined.
Gives significant details about an item's construc- tion and purpose (not specific powers).
Provides analysis of an active spell; giving its duration, the list it was cast from, and its type (not its level or exactly what spell it is).
Gives information concerning a being's death (weapon, spell, time since, etc.); must be cast in place of death (within 24 hour) or in the presence of body (no time limit).

As Text Analysis II, except everything but implications is known (e.g., answers to riddles are not known automatically). This spell gives the caster the equivalent of rank 8 knowledge in a written language.

As Spell Analysis, except will work on abilities/powers that are not currently active. One item, person, or place may be examined to see if it has power, which realm the power is from, a general idea of its origin, and its basic configuration.

Caster's awareness leaves his body (which is inactive for the duration of the spell) and may travel at 1 mile per minute. However, it can only travel 10' per round when moving through solid material or when observing the world. If the spell expires before the caster returns to his body, he will return to his body at the fixed rate of 500' per round, and upon returning to his body, he must make a RR modified by -50 or die (the attack level is equal to the number of rounds overstayed).
As Death Analysis, except gives a visual image of the killer, and a vague reason for death (e.g., revenge, robbery, accident, etc.).
Any of the lower level spells may be used together on one item, person, or place (Conveyance is not included).
As Analysis, except one item per round may be examined.
As Power Analysis, except exact origin, creator, and detailed purpose are given; this includes exact spell (when appropriate)
As Conveyance, except rate is 10 mile per minute (50' per round through solid material and while observing).

Special Notes: See Section 7.1.10 for more on detecting invisible.
For the purposes of spells on this list, "evil" is defined as something that causes (or is a source of) intentional suffering, injury, or destruction (see Section 7.1.3).

When using a Location spell, the caster must provide an unambiguous description of the object being sought. This includes a minimum of: the item�s dimensions (within 10\% of actual size) and at least two other identifying attributes (e.g., color, weight, shape, texture, etc.). Often, it will take more than two other attributes to make the description "unique" (i.e., no other item with range can possibly match the description).

Spells.Description: Detects any active spell or item from the Essence realm. Caster can concentrate on a 5'R area each round.
As Detect Essence, except realm is Mentalism.
As Detect Essence, except realm is Channeling.
As Detect Essence, except detects invisible things. All attacks against something so detected are modified by -50.
As Detect Essence, except it gives a 75\% chance of detecting a trap (trap sophistication may modify this chance).
As Detect Essence, except detects if a being is evil or an item created by evil or long used by a very evil person.
Gives the direction and distance to any specific object or place that the caster is familiar with or has had described in detail.
As Detect Essence, except it will give an estimate of the power of the person (level) or item or spell examined.
As Detect Essence, except detects dead bodies and whether anything has died in the radius in the last 24 hours.
As Location I, except range is 300'.
As Detect Essence, except detects any spell that has been cast in the area examined. Gives exact spell that was cast.
As Location I, except range is 500'.
As Perceive Power I, except range is 300'.
As Location I, except range is 1 mile.
As Detect Essence, except detects any type of detection spell that is operating in the area examined (gives exact spell detected).
Any of the lower level Detect spells can be used once per round.
As Location I, except range is 1 mile per level.

Special Notes: No spells on this list are cumulative with each other.

Spells.Description: Target is totally protected from all natural light (includes glare, sunburn, and temporary blinding; but not lightning); +10 to all RRs vs light (electricity); -10 to elemental electricity attacks.
As Resist Light, except protects against natural heat to 200 F and modifies spells involving heat by 10.
As Resist Light, except protects against natural cold to -20 F and modifies spells involving cold by 10.
As Resist Light, except all beings within 10'R of target are protected.
As Resist Heat, except all beings within 10'R of target are protected.
As Resist Cold, except all beings within 10'R of target are protected.
As Resist Light , except protects against all natural light and electricity and modifies spells involving light (electricity) by 20.
As Lightarmor, except protects against heat.
As Lightarmor, except protects against cold.
As Lightarmor, except protects all beings within 10'R.
As Heatarmor, except protects all beings within 10'R.
As Coldarmor, except protects all beings within 10'R.

As Lightarmor, except it also decreases all electrical concussion hits (e.g., from shock bolts and lightning bolts) by half, and decreases electrical critical strikes by one level (e.g., �A's are ignored, 'B's become 'A's, 'C's become 'B's, etc.)
As Lightning Armor, except fire and heat spells are affected (e.g., fire bolts and fireballs).
As Lightning Armor, except cold and ice spells are affected (e.g., ice bolts and coldballs).
As Lightarmor, except as many targets as the caster's level can be affected.
As Heatarmor, except as many targets as the caster's level can be affected.
As Coldarmor , except as many targets as the caster's level can be affected.
Acts as Lightning Armor, Fire Armor, and Ice Armor all at the same time.
Causes an object of up to 1 pound mass to vibrate rapidly; if fragile it may break (roll a RR). If it is an object held by a being the being must make a RR or fumble it (each round).
Exerts 1 pound of pressure on a person or object. Object cannot be moved by staying alone, and pressure can only be in one direction.

Can move one object, up to 1 pound in mass, up to 1' per second (with no acceleration). If the caster stops concentration before the duration is up, the object remains stationary as if it had a Staying spell of an equal weight limit cast upon it.
As Vibrations I, except mass limit is 5 pounds.
As Staying I, except mass limit is 5 pounds.
As Telekinesis I, except mass limit is 5 pounds.
As Vibrations I, except mass limit is 25 pounds.
As Staying I, except mass limit is 25 pounds.
As Vibrations I, except mass limit is 50 pounds.

By concentrating on the mind of a missile firer and the flight of the missile, the caster causes +50 to be added to the attack roll of the missile. The caster must concentrate, touch the firer and see the missile for the entire round that the missile is fired.
As Telekinesis I, except the mass limit is 25 pounds.
As Staying I, except the mass limit is 50 pounds.
As Vibrations I, except as many objects (up to 5 pounds each) as the caster's level can be vibrated (they must all be within the field of vision of the caster).
As Telekinesis I, except mass limit is 50 pounds.
As Staying I, except mass limit is 100 pounds.

Caster may ''hurl'' one object (that starts within 10' of him) of 1 pound or less with sufficient force to deliver an attack. Attacks are resolved on the Sling Attack Table with a maximum range of 300'. The OB of the attack is the caster's directed spell skill with this spell. If Arms Law is not available, use the Shock Bolt Attack Table (with a maximum range of 300') delivering Impact criticals.
As Telekinesis I, except mass limit is 100 pounds.
As Mass Vibrations, except objects may be up to 25 pounds in mass.
As Aiming, except missile attack bonus is 100.
As Staying I, except mass limit is 10 pounds per level.
As Telekinesis I, except mass limit is 10 pounds per level.
As Aiming, except missile attack automatically does maximum damage. If the target is a Large or Super Large creature, the attack is treated as a Slaying attack.

Special Notes: All that we see or seem is but a dream within a dream.

Spells.Description: Caster is aware of the presence of all sentient/ thinking beings within 20'.
Caster can pick a point up to 10' away and he will hear as if he were at that point (there can be intervening objects such as walls).

Caster�s point of hearing may be moved independently up to 100' away (moves at the rate of 10' per round). He must physically be able to go there (e.g., he could not send his point of hearing thourough walls or closed doors).
As Listen I, except the caster sees from the fixed point (it can rotate).
As Long Ear I, except the caster sees from the moving point (it can rotate).
As Listen I, except the range is 100'.
Caster can read the surface thoughts of one target.
As Watch I, except the range is 100'.
As Long Ear I, except the range is 300'.
As Listen I, except the range is 500'.
As Long Eye I, except the range is 300'.
As Watch I, except range is 500'.
As Listen I, except the range is 1 mile/level.
As Watch I, except the range is 1 mile/level.
As Listen, except the range is unlimited (the caster must be able to locate the desired point in terms of direction and distance).
As Listen True, except the caster sees instead of hearing.

Special Notes: See Section 7.1.27 for more on Illusions.

If more than one option can be added to the Illusion or Phantasm spell, the same option may be chosen more than once. For example, with an Illusion III, two options are available. The range could be doubled once to 200' and then doubled again to 400'.

The sense aspects of the illusion (mirage or phantasm) are actually created (no RR) and detecting that it is an illusion can normally be accomplished only through spells or through the use of a conflicting sense. Even after the illusion is detecte

Spells.Description: Caster can speak and his voice will appear to come from any point that he wants within 100' (point must be in his field of vision).
Creates any simple, immobile image, scene, or sounds in an area up to 10'R, or creates a set of immobile sounds in an area up to 10'R.
As Sound/Light Mirage, except cre- ates a set of immobile smells in the area of effect, or a set of immobile tastes in the area of effect.

Creates a simple, immobile image or scene up to an area of 10'R. One of the following options may also be chosen: a) an extra sense can be added (not the tactile or Presence senses), b) the duration can be doubled, c) the range can be doubled, or d) the radius of the area of effect can be doubled. All parts of the area of effect must be within the range of the spell (and all parts of the range must be in the caster�s field of vision).

Creates the image of one object or being that will move however the caster wants (as long as the caster concentrates). When the caster stops concentrating, the image remains but stops moving. The caster may resume concentra- tion again later and make the image move again (presuming that the duration has not expired). The image can be of any size that would fit in a 10'R.
Changes the visual appearance of one object. The target can be no larger than 10 pounds per level.

As Illusion II, except it can be delayed up to 24 hours. At the time of casting, the caster must decide upon the trigger for the spell. The caster can choose one of the following: 
a) time period, 
b) specified movements, 
c) specified sounds, 
d) specified smells, 
e) specified tastes.
If a sense is used to trigger the spell, that sense must be included in the illusion.
As Illusion II, except two options may be chosen. See the notes below for guidelines on how to combine the options.

As Phantasm I, except one of the following options may also be chosen: 
a) an extra sense can be added (not the tactile or Presence senses), 
b) the duration can be doubled, 
c) the range can be doubled, 
d) the radius of the area of effect can be doubled, 
e) another image can be created and moved inde- pendently of the first (all separate images must be within the caster�s field of vision and within range of the spell), or 
f) limited repetitious sounds, movements, etc can be added that do not require concentration of the caster (the proper senses in- volved must also be included with the illusion).

As Phantasm II, except it can be delayed as in Waiting Illusion II. The phantasm will move and act if given a simple command (at the time of casting), or it can deliver a short speech (if sound was one of the included senses).
As Waiting Illusion II, except two options may be chosen. See the notes below for guidelines on how to combine the options.
As Phantasm II, except two options may be chosen. See the notes below for guidelines on how to combine the options.
As Illusions III, except four options may be chosen.
As Waiting Illusion III, except three options may be chosen.
As Waiting Phantasm III, except two options may be chosen.
As Waiting Illusion III, except four options may be chosen.
As Phantasm III, except three options may be chosen.
As Waiting Phantasm III, except three options may be chosen.
As Illusions III, except six options may be chosen.
As Waiting Illusion III, except five options may be chosen.
As Phantasm III, except four options may be chosen.
As Illusion III, except nine options may be chosen.
As Phantasm III, except nine options may be chosen.

Special Notes: See Section 7.1.19 for more on how the environment affects vision.

Spells.Description: Caster can tell the exact dimensions, mass, and/or weight of one object.
Target gains double normal hearing. The results in +50 to Perception involving only hearing, +25 to Perception involving hearing and other senses.
Target may add +50 to any manuever rolls for one slow maneuver (e.g., walking a 3'' beam).
Target can see 100' on a normal night as if it were daylight. See Section 7.1.19.
Target has a 300 degree field of vision. The flank bonus for attacks against the target is lowered to +5 and the rear bonus is lowered to +15.
Target�s voice has its loudness tripled. This has no effect on spell casting capabilities (it simply allows the caster to make himself heard without difficulty over long distances).
As Nightvision, except target can see 100' in even murky water.
Target can breathe water but not air.

As Nightvision, except target can see varying degrees of heat on the surfaces of objects. This spell does not allow the caster to see ''through'' things. While this vision is sufficient for moving around, it is not sufficient at all for reading or mapping.
As Waterlungs, except target can breathe any gas as normal air.
Delays the effect of a poison on a target. If poison is not eliminated before the spell expires, the target will be affected by the poison at that time.
As Nightvision, except any darkness can be seen through. Also, no light is needed at all for this spell to work.
As Waterlungs, except target can breathe water, air, and/or any gas at will.
As Balance, except can affect one target per level of caster.
As Nightvision, except can affect one target per level of caster.
As Watervision, except can affect one target/level of caster.
As all ''vision'' spells below 15th level functioning at the same time.
As Waterlungs, except can affect 1 target per level of caster.
As Gaslungs, except can affect 1 target per level of caster.
As Vision, except can affect 1 target per level of caster.

Special Notes: Rune Paper is a special prepared paper, designed to hold enchantments. After the rune is read from the paper, it fades from the paper. The paper may then hold another rune.
The attack level of a rune is the level of the spell that is put into the rune. If the spell is an elemental attack, the reader's appropriated Directed Spell OB is used.
See the Rolemaster Standard System for more information on how to use runes.

Spells.Description: aster may cast this spell with any spell he wants to store. The spell to be stored must be cast within one minute after the Spell Store is cast. The stored spell may then be cast later as an instantatneous spell. The Spell Store spell costs the same number of PPs as the spell that is stored. No other spell may be cast while a spell is stored.

This spell inscribes a spell on a specially prepared piece of paper. The rune can then be used to cast the inscribed spell once. Spell to be inscribed must be cast within one minute after the Rune (no.) spell is cast. Rune I can only inscribe 1st level spells. The rune can be set to affect reader.
As Rune I, except up to 2nd level spells can be inscribed.
As Rune I, except up to 3rd level spells can be inscribed.
As Rune I, except up to 5th level spells can be inscribed.

(RR Mod: -20) A Sign can be inscribed on any ''non-mobile'' surface and affects the triggering being. A Sign can be triggered by one of the following (decided by caster at the time of casting): 
a) specified time has passed, 
b) specified movements within 20', 
c) specified sounds within 20', 
d) touch, or 
e) reading. 
The Sign is cancelled when a being fails a RR against it. Sign of Shock puts the target in a state of shock for 10 minutes per 10 failure (treat as if target is stunned, except target will never pass out due to this shock).
As Rune I, except up to 6th level spells can be inscribed.
As Sign of Stunning, except target will flee the location of the Sign for 1 minute per 5 failure. The target must make his RR based upon his resistance to Essence, not his resistance to Fear.
As Rune I, except up to 7th level spells can be inscribed.
As Sign of Stunning, except target falls into a magical sleep from which he cannot be awakened for 10 minute per 10 failure.
As Rune I, except up to 8th level spells can be inscribed.
As Sign of Stunning, except target is blinded for 1 hour per 10 failure.
As Rune I, except up to 9th level spells can be inscribed.
As Sign of Stunning, except target is paralyzed for 1 hour per 10 failure.
As Rune I, except up to 10th level spells can be inscribed.
see Section 7.4.
As Rune I, except up to 20th level spells can be inscribed.
As any Sign spell desired, except that it can affect a number of targets up to the level of the caster before it is canceled.
Subtracts 5 from elemental attack rolls against the target and adds 5 to all of the target's RRs versus spells.

When the caster of this spell is a target of a spell from the realm of Essence, the ''incoming'' spell must first make an RR before the caster makes an RR. For RR purposes, each spell uses a level equal to its caster's level. If the ''incoming'' spell passes the RR, it may target the caster of this spell normally; otherwise the incoming spell has no effect on this target.
As Protection I, except all beings within 10'R of target get the benefits.
As Cancel Essence except affects spells from the realm of Mentalism.
As Protection I, except bonuses are 10.
as Cancel Essence, except affects spells from the realm of Channeling.
As Protection II, except it has a 10'R as in Protection Sphere I.
As Cancel Essence, except for the area of effect (centered on the caster). If the radius encounters an already existing spell, that spell must make an RR (with a +30 modifier) or be cancelled.

Creates a shimmering shield in front of the caster. This shield subtracts 10 from all frontal Essence attack rolls on the caster (base and elemental). If the caster performs no other actions during a round, he can ''parry'' (as with a normal shield) one spell attack. The parry bonus is equal to the sum of all the bonuses that the caster would normally have for his spell's base attack roll.
As Essence Shield, except is effective only against Mentalism spells.
As Protection I, except bonuses are 15.
As Dispel Essence Sphere I, except affects spells from the realm of Mentalism.
As Essence Shield, except it is effec- tive only against Channeling spells.
As Essence Shield, except it is effective against any two of the three realms.
As Protection I, except bonuses are 20.
As Dispel Essence Sphere I, except affects spells from the realm of Channeling.
As Essence Shield, except is effective against all three realms.
As Protection I, except bonuses are 25.
Target gets a +50 bonus for all RRs versus Essence spells.
As Essence Resistance, except is only effective against Mentalism spells.
As Essence Resistance, except is only effective against Channeling spells.
As Essence Resistance, except all three realms are affected.
Caster can cause any lock he can see within 100' to be locked (the lock is just normally locked and can be opened normally).
A door (or container) can be magically ''locked.'' The door can be broken down normally or the spell can be dispelled. Otherwise, the door cannot be opened for the duration of the spell.
Gives the caster a +20 bonus for picking the lock analyzed. If the caster describes the information gained from this spell, that person will get a +10 bonus to picking the lock analyzed.

When cast upon a lock, there is a 20\% chance a normal lock will open, and a 45\% chance that a Magic Lock will open. There is a 10\% chance that any associated traps are set off. Rolls are open-ended, and the sophistication of the lock may modify the roll (see Section 7.1.29).
As Locklore, except applies to disarming traps.
As Opening I, except its chances concern disarming traps (see Section 7.1.29).
Causes a door to expand and jam into its frame. Roll d100 to determine the severity of the jam (a 01 means the door is only slightly stuck; a 100 means that the door is unopenable).
Reduces the inherent strength of a door by 50\%. All attempts to break down the door get a +50 bonus.

When cast, there is a 20\% chance that all locks within the area of effect are unlocked (45\% chance for Magic Locks). Roll separately for each lock in the area of effect. Rolls are open-ended, and the sophistication of the lock may modify the roll (see Section 7.1.29).
As Opening I, except chance is 40\% (90\% for Magic Locks).

Will vaporize a nonmagic door up to 6'' thick, 10' high and 10' wide (if the door is thicker than 6'' it will vaporize the closest 6 inches). This will only work on an object that is used as a door (i.e., a caster cannot Undoor a section of wall).
As Disarm I, except chance is 40\% (90\% for magical traps).
As Magic Lock, except duration is 1 hr/lvl and the chance that an Opening spell (or Open Prison) will work is reduced by 20\%.
As Magic Lock, except door is unbreakable by normal means.
As Undoor I, except door can be up to 2'x20'x20'.
As Open Prison I, except chance is 40\% (90\% for Magic Locks).
As Undoor I, except door can be up to 3'x50'x50'.
As Magic Lock, except duration is 1 day/lvl and the chance that an Opening spell (or Open Prison) will work is reduced by 40\%.
As Undoor I, except any single door is vaporized.
A doorway (8'x5') is created in any wall up to 6'' deep per level of the caster.
Gives the caster a 90\% chance of opening a lock. The roll is open-ended and the sophistication of the lock may modify the roll.
As Lock Mastery, except its chances concern disarming traps.
Caster can utilize any one of the lower level spells on this list each round.

Special Notes: See Section 7.2 for more information on healing.

Spells.Description: Allows caster to stop bleeding on a wound that is bleeding 1 hit per round; target may not be moved, or bleeding will resume at prior rate.
As Flowstop I, except that caster can stop bleeding on a wound that is bleeding up to 3 hits per round (total).
Allows caster to stop bleeding on a wound that is bleeding 1 hit per round; for 1 hour, target can move at no more than a walking pace, or bleeding will resume at prior rate.
As Flowstop I, except that caster can stop bleeding in a wound that is bleeding up to 5 hits per round.
Allows caster to prevent the deterioration of 1 limb (even while severed); also requires use of same spells from Muscle Law, Bone Law, and Nerve Law.
Allows caster to stop bleeding from 1 wound that is bleeding 1 hit per round.
As Clotting I, except that caster can stop bleeding in a wound that is bleeding up to 3 hits per round (total).
Allows caster to completely mend a damaged minor blood vessel (a vessel that bleeds at up to 3 hits per round, not major arteries or veins).

As Cut Repair I, except that caster can repair wound(s) that bleed(s) up to 3 hits per round (total); three 1 hit per round wounds or one 3 hit per round wound or one 2 hit per round and one 1 hit per round wound can be healed.

Allows caster to repair 1 damaged blood vessel of any size, including severed veins and arteries; recovery time: 1-10 days, depending on size of vessel and severity of damage. A major vessel is one that bleeds at 5 hit per round or more when severed.
Allows caster to reattach severed limb; also requires use of Bone Law, Muscle Law, and Nerve Law Joining spells in order to restore functional status; limb is fully functional in 10-100 days.
As Flow Stoppage I, except that all blood loss (i.e., hits per round) from one wound is stopped.
As Clotting I, except that blood loss (i.e., hits per round) from one wound is stopped.

Allows caster to remove any one blood clot; will counter Clotting Curse (on the Evil Cleric list, Curses). This spell has no affect on bleeding wounds that have clotted (i.e., ''clots'' in this sense apply only to internal blood clotting).
As Cut Repair I, except that it will stop bleeding and close any one wound.
As Flow Stoppage True, except that caster may stop bleeding from a number of wounds equal to his level (e.g., a 20th level caster can stop bleeding from 20 wounds).
As Joining, except that limb is fully functional in 10 minutes (provided caster also uses the other three Joining True spells).
As Mass Flow Stoppage, except that bleeding is stopped as in Clotting True.
Allows caster to stop bleeding in, and fully repair, 1 wound per level (e.g., a 50th level caster can fully repair a total of 50 wounds/spell cast).

Special Notes: See Section 7.2 for more information on healing.

Spells.Description: Caster acquires complete understanding of any bone damage, including the tools and methods required for healing. Caster does not receive the skill or power to perform the cure.
Allows caster to mend one simple fracture (not compound fractures, shatters, joint damage, etc.). Recovery time is one day.
Allows caster to repair all cartilage damage around one joint. Recovery time is one day.
Allows caster to prevent the deterioration of one limb (even if severed). Also requires the use of the same spell from Nerve Law, Muscle Law, and Blood Law.
As Minor Fracture Repair, except that the caster can also repair compound fractures. Recovery time is one day.
Allows caster to mend one fracture in a skull (but not a shattered area). Recovery time is 1-10 days (depending on the damage).
Allows caster to repair one broken (but not shattered). Recovery time is 1-10 days.
As Minor Fracture Repair, except recovery is instantaneous.
Allows caster to reattach a limb. Requires the use of Muscle Law, Blood Law, and Nerve Law Joining spells to restore functional status. Limb is fully functional in 10-100 days.
As Cartilage Repair, except recovery time is instantaneous.
As Major Fracture Repair, except recovery time is instantaneous.
As Skull Repair, except recovery time is instantaneous.
As Joint Repair, except recovery time is instantaneous.
Allows caster to repair any broken or shattered bone. Requires a 10 minute operation and 1-10 days recovery time.
As Minor Fracture Repair, except it repairs one minor fracture per level of the caster. Spell operates as long as caster concentrates; each mended fracture requires a one day recovery period.
As Mass Minor Fracture Repair, except it repairs cartilage (as in Cartilage Repair).
As Joining, except that the limb is fully functional in 10 minutes (provided that the caster also uses the other three Joining True spells).
As Mass Minor Fracture Repair, except for the range and it repairs major fractures (as in Major Fracture Repair).
As Mass Minor Fracture Repair, except for the range and it repairs any broken or shattered bone (as in Shatter Repair).

Special Notes: An ''aggressive'' action is defined as any action with the intent to directly harm any individual(s). Actions that result in harm indirectly to individuals are not ''aggressive.'' Pulling the lever on the wall to drop an individual into a pit is an aggressive action (the action directly resulted in the harm on an individual). Running away to get help is not an aggressive action.

Spells.Description: Target will take no aggressive/offensive action, and will fight only if attacked.
As Calm I, except 2 targets may be affected.
Humanoid target is held to 25\% of normal action.
As Calm I, except 3 targets may be affected.
As Calm I, except 4 targets may affected.
As Calm I, except 5 targets may be affected.
Caster can calm a number of animals equal to his level.
As Hold Kind, except it will affect any target.
As Calm I, except that 10 targets may be affected.
All targets in radius must resist or they are calmed.
As Mass Animal Calming I, except RRs are modified by -20 and the range is 10'/lvl.
Allows Caster to calm up to 20 targets.
Caster can calm any 1 target.
Caster can calm a number of targets equal to his level.
Caster can calm any 1 target.

Special Notes: See Section 7.2 for more information on the effects of herbs.

Spells.Description: Allows caster to go without food or water and not suffer damage (i.e., provides nutrition and water for 1 day).
Caster can produce sufficient in any available receptacle to supply a being for one day.
Caster can produce sufficient food from the surrounding area to feed 1 hearty appetite for 1 day.
Allows caster to set a fire of 1'R; fire will then last as long as there is fuel. A target in the 1'R will take an 'A' Heat critical.
Caster can produce 1 loaf of waybread that weighs .5lb and will support 1 being for 1 day; the loaf will lose potency in 1 month.
As Water Production I, except caster can produce 3 days of water.
As Food Production I, except caster can produce sufficient food to feed 3 beings for 1 day.
Allows caster to enhance the potency of any 1 growing herb by 100\% (i.e., x2); spell may be employed only once per herb.
As Water Production I, except caster can produce 5 days of water.
As Food Production I, except caster can produce sufficient food to feed 5 beings for 1 day.
As Nutrient Conjure I, except caster can produce 3 loaves of waybread.
Caster can double the potency of any 1 herb (growing or dead); spell may be employed only once/herb. May not be combined with Herb Enhancement.
Caster can produce a plant up to 10' in height and/or width; plant must be commonly found in the region.
As Water Production I, except caster can create 1 day of water per level (e.g., a 17th level Cleric could create 17 days of water).
As Food Production I, except caster can produce sufficient food to feed a number of beings equal to his level.
Caster can create an animal representative of the surrounding region and weighing no more than 10 pounds; animal will be friendly to caster.
As Nutrient Conjure I, except caster can produce loaves of waybread equal to his level.

As Lesser Plant Production, except that caster can create 1 plant with a height and/or width of 1' per level (e.g., a 30th level could produce a 20' high tree with a 30' maximum width); plant must be commonly found in the local area.
As Lesser Animal Production, except that caster can produce an animal with a maximum weight of 1 pound per level; the animal must be a native of the area.

Special Notes: When using Guess, the caster must have a limited number of options (i.e., finite and countable). After the spell is cast, the caster may not cast another Guess for the same information until his experience level has increased (see Section 7.1.4).
A path is defined as either: a trodden path/way or a road/way/track made for a particular purpose. (See also Section 7.1.25).

When using any Location spell, the caster must provide an unambiguous description of the object being sought. This includes a minimum of: the item's dimensions (within 10\% of actual size) and at least two other identifying attributes (e.g., color, weight, shape, texture, etc.). Often, it will take more than two other attributes to make the description ''unique'' (i.e., no other item within range can possibly match the description).

Spells.Description: When faced with a choice about which he has little or no information (e.g., which corridor leads outside the quick- est) the caster may cast this spell and the Gamemaster will determine which way he goes, biasing the choice favorable by 25% (e.g, roll 1-100: correct on 26-100, incorrect on 01-25)
Caster learns the location(s) of any ''path(s)'' within 100'; gives the nearest point on path, but not the path's course.

The caster is subtly directed (hints and clues) towards a specific destination (within 100'/lvl) by guidance from his deity. The exact form of the guidance may vary from deity to deity (e.g., a deity of water might leave hints in the rocks of a stream, etc.). For the duration of the spell, the caster must concentrate on following the guidance.
Gives the direction and distance to any specific object or place that the caster is familiar with or has had described in detail.
As Pathfinding I, except range is 300'.
As Location I, except range is 300'.
As Pathfinding I, except range is 500'.
As Location I, except range is 500'.

Caster can remember an exact route he traveled; whether or not he was without one or more of his senses when he made his original journey (e.g., a 12th level caster could remember the course of 12 hours of a trip even if he had been blindfolded). To be effective, this spell must be cast within 1 month of the journey.
As Pathfinding I, except range is 1 mile.

As Guidance, except the form of the guidance is that of an animal companion sent by the deity. The caster can follow the animal to a specific destination. If more than 24 hours pass without the caster making progress towards the destination, the animal will leave.
Caster can locate any 1 object he describes, if indeed it exists and is in range (e.g., caster could describe a type of mace he had never seen or heard of).
As Location I, except range is 1 mile.
As Pathfinding I, except range is 10 miles.
As Finding I, except range is 300'.
As Location I, except range is 20 miles.
As Pathfinding I, except range is 1 mile per level and exact route(s) within the range are ascertained.
As Location I, except range is 1 mi per level.
As Finding, except range is 100' per level.

Special Notes: A �curse� is usually something that is detrimental and magical in nature (e.g., delivered from the Curses spell list). The GM may decide that the ''!curses'' spells on this list only apply to
''magical'' curses. Normally, curses may not be Dispelled; they may only be affected by Remove Curse spells.
''Evil,'' ''Good,'' ''Holy,'' ''Of Darkness,'' and ''Of Light'' are defined and discussed in Section 7.1.3.

Spells.Description: Allows caster virtual total recall of any conversation or writing he encountered within a period of days equal to his level.
Detects ''true evil'' in an animate or inanimate target; caster can concentrate on a 5'R area each round.
As Detect Evil, except caster can detect curses.

As Detect Evil, except caster can detect extremes of emotion (e.g., hatred, love, sadness, etc.). In addition, the caster learns which emotions the target is feeling in extreme. If there are no extremes of emotion (i.e., only normal feelings), this spell detects nothing.
Caster can ascertain the origin point and nature of any 1 ''holy item'' that is not ''of darkness'' or ''of evil'' will not give specific capabilities.
Caster can ascertain exact nature and type of poison; he can determine what cure may be used, but does not receive the required tools or skills.

Caster can determine the nature and type of any 1 living target. He will not be able to ascertain the target�s personal traits or capabilities, but will know the normal abilities associated with the target�s species.
Caster can determine nature and origin of any 1 curse, including the name of the one who bequeathed it.
As Light Lore I, except caster can ascertain the origin point and nature of any 1 item ''of darkness'' or ''of evil.''

As Light Lore I, except that caster can ascertain the origin point and nature of any 2 ''holy items'' or caster can determine the nature, origin point, and the exact significance of any 1 ''holy item.''
Caster can determine the nature and origin of extreme emotion(s) found within any 1 target (inanimate or animate); the degree and other details of the emotion(s) can also be acquired.

As Light Lore I, except that caster can ascertain the origin point and nature of any 3 ''holy items'' or caster can determine the age, origin point, name of the creator, and nature of any 1 ''holy item.'' Caster also learns item's specific capabilities.
As Light Lore II, except that it can only be used on items ''of darkness'' or ''of evil.''
Caster can ascertain exact nature, origin, purpose, and history of any 1 ''holy item;'' it allows caster to visualize all who have possessed the item.
As Light Lore III, except that it can be used only on items of evil or ''darkness.''
As Life Lore, except caster can determine specific traits and capabilities of any 1 target.
As White Lore, except it can only be used on an item ''of darkness'' or ''of evil.''
As White Lore, except caster can acquire the information on all ''holy items'' within 100'.

Special Notes: See Section 7.2 for more information on healing.

Spells.Description: Caster acquires a complete understanding of any muscle damage, including the tools and methods required for healing; caster does not receive the skill or power to perform the cure.
As Muscle Lore, except the knowledge obtained concerns the healing of tendon damage.
Allows caster to repair (not replace) 1 sprain; recovery time: 1 hour.
Allows caster to repair (not replace) 1 damaged muscle; recovery time: 1 hour.
Allows caster to prevent the deterioration of 1 limb (even while severed); also requires use of same spells from Nerve Law, Bone Law, and Blood Law.
Allows caster to repair one damaged tendon; recovery time: 1 hour.
As Muscle Repair I, except caster can repair 3 damaged muscles.
As Tendon Repair I, except caster can repair 3 damaged tendons.
Allows caster to reattach limb, but requires use of Bone Law, Blood Law, and Nerve Law Joining spells in order to restore functional status; limb is fully functional in 1-10 days.
As Muscle Repair I, except recovery is instantaneous and requires 1 minute ''operation'' (concentration by caster).
As Tendon Repair I, except recovery is instantaneous and requires 1 minute ''operation'' (concentration by caster).

Allows repair of 1 muscle per level of the caster (e.g., a 17th level caster can repair 17 muscles); spell can be used as long as caster concentrates (i.e., caster can move from target to target until he has healed a number of muscles equal to his level); recovery time: 1 hour.
As Mass Muscle Repair, except caster heals tendons.
Allows caster to regenerate 1 muscle; regrowth takes 1-10 hrs, depending on extent of loss.
As Joining, except limb is fully functional in 10 minutes (provided caster also uses the other three Joining True spells).
Allows caster to regenerate 1 tendon; regrowth takes 1-10 hrs, depending on extent of loss.
As Mass Muscle Repair, except any combination of muscles and tendons may be healed, the range is 100', and recovery is instantaneous.

Special Notes: See Section 7.2 for more information on healing.

Spells.Description: Caster acquires complete understanding of any nerve damage, including the tools and methods required for healing: caster does not receive the skill or power to perform the cure.
Allows caster to repair minor damage to 1 nerve; requires 1 day recovery period. Minor damage is defined as any nerve damage that results in penalties up to -20.
Allows caster to prevent the deterioration of 1 limb (even while severed); also requires use of same spells from Muscle Law, Bone Law, and Blood Law.
As Minor Nerve Repair, except will heal any nerve damage.
Caster can cure any 1 paralysis problem.
As Minor Nerve Repair, except there is no recovery time.
Allows caster to reattach limb, but requires use of Bone Law, Muscle Law, and Blood Law Joining spells in order to restore functional status; limb is fully functional in 10-100 days.

Allows caster to repair minor brain damage (including recovery from coma); note that experience lost is not restored (% lost permanently dependent on severity of damage); requires a 1 hour operation; recovery time: 1-10 days.
As Major Nerve Repair, except that there is no recovery period required.
Allows caster to cure paralysis in 1 target (recovery time of 1-10 days); paralysis must have resulted from a spell or disease (not a poison).
Allows caster to repair a minor psychosis in 1 target (recovery time of 1-10 days). Minor psychoses include mild to moderate phobias (see GM Law for more on mind diseases).
As Nerve Repair True, except that each spell cast affects 1 nerve per level of caster.
As Joining, except that limb is fully functional in only 10 minutes (provided caster also uses the other three Joining True spells).
Allows caster to regenerate lost nerve; regrowth takes 1-10 days, depending on extent of loss.

Allows caster to regenerate lost brain material; regrowth takes 10-100 days, depending on extent of damage; target is in coma during recovery; note that experience lost is not restored (amount lost permanently is dependent on severity of damage).

Special Notes: See Section 7.2 for more information on healing.

Spells.Description: Caster acquires complete understanding of any organ damage, including the tools and the methods required for healing; caster does not receive the skill or power to perform the cure.
Allows caster to repair any nose damage short of complete nose loss; requires 6-60 minutes depending on damage.
Caster can repair any external damage, including ear loss (regeneration takes 1-10 hours).
Allows caster to repair any minor eye damage (e.g., corneal scratch, removal of foreign object, etc.).
As Minor Ear Repair except that caster can repair any interior or exterior damage; hearing is restored in 1-10 days (note that complete replacement of the inner ear is an exception).
As Minor Eye Repair, except that caster can repair any eye damage short of total eye loss (e.g., eye�s destruction precludes repair); recovery time: 1-10 days.
Allows caster to repair any heart damage short of total loss or destruction (i.e., replacement); requires 1-10 hour operation and 1-100 day recovery time.
