Allows caster to repair any lung damage short of total loss or destruction (i.e., replacement); requires a 1-10 hour operation and 1-100 day recovery time.
Allows caster to repair any internal or external organ damage (not including the brain or nervous system); requires a 1-10 hour operation and 1-10 day recovery time.
Allows target to regenerate 1 lost nose; regrowth takes 1-10 days.
Allows caster to transplant 1 healthy organ; operation takes 1 hour; recovery time: 1-10 days; chance of rejection is 10\% if same race, 50\% if other humanoid.
Allows target to regenerate 1 lost eye or ear (including inner ear); regrowth takes 1-10 days, depending on loss.
As Organ Repair, except recovery time is 10 minutes and no operation is required.
Allows caster to regenerate heart; regrowth takes 1-10 days.
Allows caster to regenerate any internal or external organ (not including the brain or nervous system); regrowth takes 1-10 days.

Special Notes: A symbol is permanent unless dispelled magically or unless the stone it is placed upon is moved.
The precise size of a symbol may vary. Suggested sizes range from 3" x 3" to 1' x 1'.

The GM may decide to make the attack level of the symbol equal to the type of Symbol spell used. For example, a first level spell placed in a Symbol X would attack as a 10th level spell rather than a 1st level spell.

Spells.Description: Caster learns what spell is emplaced within one Symbol within 50'. The Symbol will not be triggered (unless specifically created to be triggered by an Analyze Symbol spell).

This spell ''primes'' the next spell cast by the caster�that spell is treated as if it were instantaneous. The PP cost of this spell is equal to the highest level that the caster desires to be primed. For example, if the caster wants any fourth level spell (or less) to be treated as instantaneous, this spell will cost 4 PPs. In addition, when casting this spell, the caster must pray for one minute per PP spent in the spell. For example, if the caster spends 4 PPs on this spell, he must pray for 4 minutes before this spell is completed. Any interruption of this process results in the failure of this spell. The effects of this spell end when the caster casts his next spell (even if the next spell is higher level than the number of PPs expended on this spell). (Got all that?)

Caster can remove one Symbol I (an emplaced 1st level spell). The Symbol's RR is based on the level of the spell in the Symbol spell (the target level) and the level of the Unsymbol spell (the attack level).

Caster can emplace one 1st level spell on any 1 given non-mobile stone (see below). Within one minute, the spell to be emplaced must also be cast (within 10'). The symbol is usually visible, but is only required to be visible if reading is the trigger (see below). 
\begin{itemize}
\item The Symbol must be placed on a slab of stone (block, piece, etc.) weighing at least 2,000 pounds. Only one Symbol may be placed on each continuous slab. The stone may not be moved without dispelling the Symbol.
\item A Symbol can be triggered by one of the following (decided by caster): time period, specified movements, specified sounds, touch, reading, violent actions in the area, etc. The triggering range is normally 10' or the range of the emplaced spell, whichever is larger. 
\item If the spell emplaced is an attack spell, the attack level isCaster can emplace one 1st level spell on any 1 given non-mobile stone (see below). Within one minute, the spell to be emplaced must also be cast (within 10'). The symbol is usually visible, but is only required to be visible if reading is the trigger (see below). \item The Symbol must be placed on a slab of stone (block, piece, etc.) weighing at least 2,000 pounds. Only one Symbol may be placed on each continuous slab. The stone may not be moved without dispelling the Symbol. 
\item A Symbol can be triggered by one of the following (decided by caster): time period, specified movements, specified sounds, touch, reading, violent actions in the area, etc. The triggering range is normally 10' or the range of the emplaced spell, whichever is larger. \item If the spell emplaced is an attack spell, the attack level is the spell's level (i.e., for Symbol I the attack level is always 1st level, not the level of the caster). If the spell is an elemental attack, the OB is normally +0. However, the attack can be focused on a location (as opposed to simply the person who triggers the symbol). In this case, the OB is +50. 
\item Normally, if the Symbol affects a being or thing (e.g., healing, attacks, etc.), it can be triggered only once per day. 
\end{itemize}
As above, except a 2nd level spell is emplaced.
As above, except 2nd level spell is removed.
As above, except a 3rd level spell is emplaced.
As Analyze Symbol, except caster learns what spells are emplaced in all Symbols within a 50'R.
As above, except a 5th level spell may be emplaced.
As above, except 3rd level spell is removed.
As above, except a 6th level spell is removed.
As above, except 7th level spell is emplaced.
As above, except 5th level spell is removed.
As above, except a 8th level spell is emplaced.
As above, except 10th level spell is removed.
As above, except a 9th level spell is emplaced.
As above, except a 10th level spell is emplaced.
See Section 7.4.
As above, except a 20th level spell is emplaced.
As above, except caster can remove any spell of a level less than his own (e.g., a 50th level Cleric could remove a 49th level spell, but not a 50th level spell).

Special Notes: All "Wall" spells created by spells on this list must rest (i.e., stand) on a solid surface.\\\\All "Wall" spells (except 'Wall of Force') require that at least 1 cubic foot of the material that the wall consists of be within 50' of the caster.\\\\With all walls, the caster has the option of varying the width and height (not the thickness) up to the allowed dimensions. If the caster ist attempting to "fill" a space with the wall, the wall will not fit perfectly (i.e., not snug).\\\\A wall cannot be created in the same space as other solid material. it can only displace liquids and gasses.

Spells.Description: Creates a wall a black, insubstantial wall up to  20' x 20' x 1'' that light cannot pass into ort through (i.e., it does not hinder movement, but it blocks vision).
Creates a wall if dense churning air up to 10' x 10' x 3'. This reduces all Movement through it by 50%. In addition, all attacks through the wall suffers a -50 penalty.
As Light Wall I, except for duration.
Creates a wall of water up to 10' x 10' x 1'. This wall reduces all movement through it by 80%. In addition, all attacks through the wall suffer a -80 penalty.
Creates a wall of wood up to 10' x 20' x 2''. This wall can be burned though, chopped through, or toppled (if not propped up somehow).
As Woodwall, except wall is made of earth and has a size up to 10' x 10' x (3' at base, 1' at top) of packed earth.
As Woodwall, except wall is made of ice and has a size up to 10' x 10' x (2' at base, 1' at top). It can be melted through, chipped through, or toppled (if not propped up somehow).

Opens a pit (500 cubic feet in stone; 1000 cubic feet in earth or ice). The entire pit must be within 50' of caster. A pit may not be opened except on a horizontal surface with an incline of less than 45 degree.
As Airwall, except for duration.
As Woodwall, except wall is made of stone and has a size up to 10' x 10' x 1'. It can be chipped through.
As Waterwall, except for duration.
As Woodwall, except for duration.
As Earth Wall, except for duration.
As Icewall I, except wall is up to 20' x 20' x (4' at base, 2' at top).
As Stonewall, except for duration.
Fuses 2 touching walls (seam can be up to 20' long) or fuses a section of stone blocks (up to 100 cubic feet).
As any one of the lower level ''wall'' spells on this list, except the wall can be curved up to a semicircle.
By directly Channeling the power of his deity, the caster creates a transparent wall of ''force'' that is absolutely impassable by anyone or anything. It can be up to 10' x 20' x 1''.

Special Notes: See Section 7.2 for more on healing.

Spells.Description: Target is healed of d10 concussion hits.
Target ist healed of one area up to mild frostbite or 1st degree burn.
Target is healed of one minor irritation (e.g., headachem toothache, bee-sting, hangover, etc.).
As Healing I, except that target is healed of 3d10 concussion hits.
Target is relieved of 1 round's worth of accumulated stun effects. See Section 7.1.1 for more information.
As Frost/Burn Relief I, except caster can heal 2 areas of mild damage or 1 area of moderate damage (e.g., 2nd degree burn).

Will reduce damage target has by 1 hit every minute as long as caster concentrates. If the caster is unconscious this spell will operate on him without concentration. See Appendix 7.1.1 for more on subconscious spells.
As Healing I except that target is healed of 5d10 concussion hits.
As Frost/Burn Relief I, except caster can heal 3 areas of mild damage or 1 area of severe damage (e.g., 3rd degree burn) or a combination of 1 mild and 1 moderate area of damage.
Target is instantly awake.
As Healing I, except that target is healed of 7d10 concussion hits.
As Regeneration I, except target's damage is reduced by 2 hits per minute of concentration.
As Frost/Burn Relief I, except caster can heal 4 mild or 2 moderate or 1 mild and 1 severe or 2 mild and 1 moderate area(s) of damage.
As Healing I, except that target is healed of 10d10 concussion hits
As Stun Relief, except that the caster's range is 100'.
As Regeneration I, except target's damage is reduced by 3 hits per minute.
As Healing I, except that target is healed of 15d10 concussion hits.
As Regeneration I, except target's damage is reduced by 5 hits per minute.
As Healing I, except that target is healed of all concussion hits.
Spells.Spell: True HealingAs Healing I, except that target is healed of all concussion hits.

Spells.Description: Allows caster to heal all concussion hits in a number of targets equal to level of caster.

Special Notes: All of the spells on this list are Passive in type. The target of the spell is allowed an RR, but success only indicates that the target is aware that a spell was cast upon him (i.e., the spell still works). More information on Passive spell effects may be found in Section 7.1.18.\\\\A ''curse'' (for the purposes of the Detect Curse spell) is defined as something that is detrimental and magical in nature (e.g., delivered from the Curses spell list).

Spells.Description: Detects any active spell or item from the Channeling realm; caster can concentrate on a different 5'R each round.
As Detect Channeling, except realm is Essence.
As Detect Channeling, except realm is Mentalism.
As Detect Channeling, except detects living beings.
As Detect Channeling, except detects curses on people or things.
As Detect Channeling, except detects the presence of Undead.
As Detect Channeling, except it gives a 75\% chance of detecting a trap (trap sophistication modifiers may reduce or enhance this chance). See Section 7.1.28 for informa- tion on trap complexity.
As Detect Channeling, except it analyzes one living being; giving race, age, and current state of health.
As Detect Channeling, except detects invisible things. All attacks against an invisible target suffer a -50 penalty (instead of the standard -100). See Section 7.1.10 for more in Invisibility.
As Detect Channeling, except it will give an estimate of the power (i.e., level) of the person, item, or spell examined.
As Detect Channeling, except it gives an analysis of any poisons on a single object or in a single being.
As Detect Channeling, except it analyzes general spell type (in item or cast) and what spell list it was cast from. In the case of a person, it gives his exact profession.
As Detect Channeling, except detects any spell that has ever been cast in the area examined.
As Perceive Power I, except range is 500' and area is 50'R.

Gives the direction and distance to any specific object or place that the caster is familiar with or has had described in detail. The caster must have the dimensions of the object exact within 10\% of actual size and know at least two other attributes that make the item unique (e.g., color, texture, weight, etc.). Note that sometimes the caster must know more than two other attributes to make the item unique.
As Detect Channeling, except a curse may be analyzed for level, effect and required cure.
As Life Typing, except also gives exact profession, alignment, and other pertinent details.
As Detect Channeling, except any of the lower level spells on this list can be used once per round.
As Location, except range is 1 mile per level.

Special Notes: None of the Aura spells (Aura, True Aura, Mass Aura, and Alkar) are cumulative with each other or with the Blur spell.

Spells.Description: Beam of light (like a flashlight) springs from the caster's palm; 50' effective range. If the caster closes his fist, the light will ''turn off''; when the fist is opened, the light will come back on (so long as the spell duration has not expired).
Lights a 10'R area about the point touched; if the point is on a mobile object or being, it will move with the object/being. See Section 7.1.7.
Creates a bright aura about the target, making him appear more powerful and subtracting 10 from all attacks against the target.
As Light I, except 1 or 2 areas can be created with a total radius of 20' (e.g., one area of 20' or two areas of 10').
Causes a 10'R burst of intense light, all within are stunned for 1 round per 10 failure.
As Aura, except it makes him appear very powerful; subtracting 15 from all attacks against the target.
A bolt of intense, charged light is shot form the palm of the caster; results are determined on the Shock Bolt Attack Table.
As Light II, up to 3 areas can be created with a total radius of 30'.
As Light I, except it is the equivalent of full daylight; it also nullifies all magically created darkness for the duration.
As Light I, except caster can delay the spell up to 24 hours; it can be triggered by one of the following (decided by caster): elapsed time, specific movements, specific sounds, or touch.

A 6" radius ball of light is shot from the palm of the caster. It will travel to the limit of the range, explode (as a flare), burn with a bright light (as a flare), drift slowly to earth, and go out. An area equal to the range is lit if the flare can raise to its full range. If used against a target, use the Shock Bolt Attack Table but deliver Heat criticals.
As Light III, except up to 5 areas can be created with a total radius of 50'.
As Light III, except up to 10 areas can be created with a total radius of 100'.
As Utterlight I, except up to 5 areas can be created with a total radius of 50'.
As Light III, except total radius is 10' per level.
As Aura, except as many targets as the caster's level can be affected.

Caster can cause a lightning bolt to strike a target within his range. Results are determined on the Lightning Bolt Attack Table. There must be a storm within 1 mile that is severe enough to cause precipitation or lightning or very heavy winds. The caster must be outdoors to cast this spell.
As Aura, except target seems like a minor god and the subtraction is 25.
As Utterlight I, except as many areas as the caster levels can be created with a total radius of 10' per level.
Target can walk along narrow edges (down to 2'' wide) that can support his weight. Maneuver rolls are not normally required.
Target can walk along tree limbs as if he were on level ground.
Target can walk on stone surfaces of up to 60 degree as if he were on level ground.
Target can walk on water as if he were on level ground; may not be used on rough water.

Target can merge into organic material (live or dead). While merged, the target cannot move or perceive. When the target emerges from the material, he can emerge from any side or face of the material. The target cannot move ''through'' material greater in width than his own body size plus 2 feet.

Caster ''stores'' a location for use with spells later on this list. While casting this spell, the caster must meditate for one hour in the location that will be stored. The caster can only have one sanctuary stored at a time. As long as this location remains ''stored,'' it will detect as a magical (i.e., ''holy'') place.
As Limbwalking, except target can run.
As Stonewalking, except target can run.
As Waterwalking, except target can run.
Target can walk on calm air. This spell only allows for horizontal movement. Vertical movement must be achieved by other means.
Caster may return to his stored sanctuary so long as the sanctuary is no more than 1 mile away.
As Merging Organic, except target may turn within the material and perceive the world outside of the material.
As Returning I, except the sanctuary can be up to 5 miles away.
As Windwalking, except target can run.
As Returning I, except the sanctuary can be up to 10 miles away.
As Great Merging Organic, except target may use spells on himself while merged.
As Windrunning, except target can run up to twice the normal speed on calm air without expending energy.
As Returning I, except the sanctuary can be any distance away up to 10 miles per level of the caster.
Caster may go to his sanctuary (as per Word of Return), stay up to 1 round per level, and then return to the point where he cast his spell (thus making it a round trip).

Special Notes: Any spell that provides information to the caster can be tricky for the GM to run. Every GM should examine lore spells and determine how much information he is willing to impart to the players. See Section 7.1.21 for more information on Lore spells.
A herb is defined as a plant that, when specially prepared, provides some unusual benefit to the user. This does not apply to poisons.

Spells.Description: Caster learns nature, history, and value of any 1 plant.
Caster can understand the nature, origin, and value of any 1 herb; if the plant is not an herb, no information will be related.
Caster learns the nature, history, and origin of any 1 stone.
Caster can increase speed of growth for any 1 species of plant within the radius by 10 times.
Allows caster to understand and ''speak'' the language of any 1 animal species.
Caster can control the actions of any 1 animal.
Caster can monitor animate activity in the area (e.g., he will be aware of subtle movements). For the duration of the spell, the caster cannot move.
Allows caster to understand and ''speak'' the language of any 1 plant species.
As Animal Mastery I, except caster can control 3 animals.
Caster can understand and/or visualize the thoughts and emotions of any 1 animal.
Caster can control the automatic and/or mental processes of any 1 plant. Caster can also control the plant's movements. Note that this spell does not allow movement beyond normal allowances.
Caster can communicate with any 1 stone if it possesses any animate qualities (e.g., caster could speak to a holy stone that possesses an intelligence).
Caster can grow an herb by planting the proper seed. The herb is sterile and the growth takes 1-10 rounds.
As Animal Mastery I, except caster can control 5 animals.
As Plant Control I, except caster can control any 3 plants.
As Nature's Awareness I, except that the radius is 500'.
Caster can understand and/or visualize the thoughts and emotions of any 1 animal, plant, stone, or dead organic object. The caster can change targets once per round.

As Animal Mastery I, except caster can control all of the animals of a given species within a range equal to 10' x his level (e.g., at 30th level you could control all of the ferrets or minks within 300').
As Animal Mastery I, except duration is permanent and concentration is not required. At a given time, there may only be 1 animal controlled by caster through use of this spell.

Special Notes: Punishment had not been spared -- with best results in patience and purification.

Spells.Description: Stops infection and/or spread of a disease in 1 target after he has acquired the disease. No further damage will occur in uninfected areas of the body.
This spell perfectly preserves one day's worth of food for 1 week, after which it will spoil normally.
Neutralizes any 1 poison in the system of 1 target. Note: Damage already sustained is not cured.
For the duration of the spell, target gets an additional RR versus any disease(s).
For the duration of the spell, target gets an additional RR versus any poison(s).

This spell neutralizes abnormal diseases, poison, and other similar substances in one day's worth of food and/or water. It will not neutralize a poison or similar substance that is a natural part of the food (e.g., it will not neutralize the natural poison in poisoned mushrooms).
As Disease Resistance I, except target gets 2 additional Rrs.
As Poison Resistance I, except target gets 2 additional Rrs.
Target is cured of any 1 mind disease, recovery 1-50 days.
As Disease Resistance I, except target gets 3 additional Rrs.
As Poison Resistance I, except target gets 3 additional Rrs.
Caster can remove any 1 disease from a target.
Caster can remove any 1 poison from a target.
Caster can remove any 1 disease from a number of targets equal to his level (e.g., an 18th level caster could remove leprosy from 18 targets).
Caster can remove any 1 poison from the systems of a number of targets equal to his level.
As Mind Disease Cures, except recovery is instantaneous.
All disease in the area is eliminated.
All poison in the area is neutralized.
Eliminates all poisons and/or diseases in the area.

Target is able to communicate basic ideas in the language of a specific being (e.g., hungry, thirsty, bathroom, peace, etc.). For the duration of the spell, the target has the equivalent of skill rank 2 in the language.

Creates a 1'R area around the target, into and out of which sound cannot travel; if the point is on a mobile object or being, it will move with the object/being; +25 to Stalking attempts. See Section 7.1.7.
Creates a plane (up to 20' x 20'), through which sound will not pass.

As Speech I, except target can communicate in more complex concepts, although there is a good chance of misinterpretations. For the duration of the spell, the target has the equivalent of skill rank 4 in the language.
As Quiet I, except radius is 10'.
As Quiet I, except 3 targets can be affected.
As Soundwall I, except 5 such walls are created. Each Soundwall must be connected to at least one other Soundwall.
As Quiet I, except 5 targets may be affected.
As Silence I, except radius is 50'.

As Speech II, except target is reasonably fluent in the language. Target�s accent is imperfect, but there is only a slight chance of misinterpretation. For the duration of the spell, the target has the equivalent of skill rank 6 in the language.
Target can speak at 5 times his normal loudness.
As Silence I, except radius is 100'.
As Soundwall V, except as many Soundwalls as the target�s level can be created.
As Quiet I, except as many targets as the target�s level can be affected.

As Speech III, except for the duration and the target speaks the specified language as if he were a native. For the duration of the spell, the target has the equivalent of skill rank 8 in the language.
Subtracts 5 from elemental attack rolls against the target, and adds 5 to all of the target's RRs versus spells.

When the caster of this spell is a target of a spell from the realm of Channeling, the ''incoming'' spell must first make an RR before the caster makes an RR. For RR purposes, each spell uses a level equal to its caster's level. If the ''incoming'' spell passes the RR, it may target the caster of this spell normally; otherwise the incoming spell has no effect on this target.
As Protection I, except for duration and all beings within 10' of target get the benefits.
As Cancel Channeling, except the caster is protected from spells in the realm of Essence.
As Protection I, except bonuses are 10.
As Cancel Channeling, except the caster is protected from spells in the realm of Mentalism.
As Protection Sphere I, except bonuses are 10.
Any active spell from the realm of Channeling that is on the target must make an RR (use the level of that spell's caster as the spell's level). If the spell fails its RR, it is dispelled.

Creates a shimmering shield in front of the caster. This shield subtracts 10 from all frontal Channeling attack rolls on the caster (base and elemental). If the caster performs no other actions during a round, he can ''parry'' (as with a normal shield) one spell attack. The parry bonus is equal to the sum of all the bonuses that the caster would normally have for his spell's base attack roll.
As Protection I, except bonuses are 15.
As Channeling Shield, except is effective only against Essence spells.
As Dispel Channeling, except effects spells in the realm of Essence.
As Channeling Shield, except is effective only against Mentalism spells.
As Protection I, except bonuses are 20.
As Channeling Shield, except it is effective against two realms of the caster's choice.
As Dispel Channeling, except effects spells in the realm of Mentalism.
As Protection I, except bonuses are 25.
As Channeling Shield, except all three realms are affected.
Target gets +50 to all RRs against Channeling spells.
As Channeling Resistance, except is only effective against Essence spells.
As Channeling Resistance, except is only effective against Mentalism spells.
As Channeling Resistance, except is effective against all three realms.

Special Notes: All weather generating spells cause weather to gradually form over a period of one minute. In addition, weather generating spells have no effect in areas where there are not normally occurring weather patterns (i.e., inside buildings, etc.).

Spells.Description: Caster can ascertain information from the surrounding atmosphere. Information that may be gained includes: temperature, humidity, barometric pressure, and wind speed. The caster can gain a different piece of information each round.
Gives caster a 95\% chance of predicting the time and type of precipitation (+/-15 minutes) over the next 24 hour period.
As Rain Prediction, except it allows a 95\% chance of predicting the time and type of a storm, +/-15 minutes over the next 24 hour period.
As Rain Prediction except it allows 95\% chance of predicting time, type, and severity of weather (+/-15 minutes) over the next 24 hour period.
Caster causes a breeze to come forth that will drive out any gaseous matter (cloud, etc.) and subtracts from all missile attacks (-10). Once set, the direction of the breeze will not change.
Caster causes fog to arise that obscures all vision in and through the radius. All missile attacks into or out of the fog are modified by -10 to -50 (GM's discretion).
As Weather Prediction I, except that caster has a 95\% chance of predicting weather over a 3 day period.
Caster causes rain or snow (depending on temperature) to fall. The precipitation obscures vision into the radius by 25\% and modifies all missile attacks passing through any part of the area by -25.
As Weather Prediction I, except that caster has a 95\% chance of predicting weather over a 5 day period.

Caster can control the speed and direction of the wind. Caster can increase or decrease wind speed by 1 mph x his level (e.g., if the wind speed is normally 20 mph, a 15th level caster could reset the wind speed to any speed between 5 and 35 mph). By directing the wind against missile attacks he can cause a -1 modification for each mph of wind speed. Note that caster can also control the direction of the flow of gases and/or clouds.
Caster can make the skies clear of haze, precipitation, clouds, etc. This spell will not affect the wind.
As Weather Prediction I, except that caster has a 95\% chance of predicting weather over a 30 day period.

Caster can summon rain of moderate intensity. The rain will obscure short range vision by up to 25\% and long range vision by up to 75\%. In addition, missile attacks will suffer penalties. Short-ranged attacks suffer a -25. Mediumranged attacks suffer a 75. Long-ranged attacks are not possible.
Caster may use any of the lower level spells on this list, but with an increased area of effect (1 mile radius).

Caster may call forth a storm of any type with maximum wind speeds equal to twice his level, and an intensity according to his desires. Effects will vary according to circumstance (and the GM's discretion). For example, a 30th level caster could summon a lightning storm with intense rain and constant wind speeds of up to 60 m.p.h.: the GM may wish to have random rolls to determine possible lightning strikes versus exposed targets.

Caster may indicate the weather conditions in the area, modifying wind speeds by +/-1 m.p.h. per level, and setting the level of intensity, fog, cloud cover etc. Caster may call for shifts in the patterns as he concentrates, but the change will take at least 1 minute.

Special Notes: See Section 7.2 for more on healing.

Spells.Description: Caster is healed of d10 concussion hits.
Will heal one area of mild frostbite or a 1st degree burn.
Caster is relieved of 1 round�s worth of accumulated stun effects (see Section 7.1.1).
Reduces damage by 1 hit every round as long as caster concentrates. If caster is unconscious, this spell will operate without concentration (see Section 7.1.1).
As Frost/Burn Relief I, except 2 areas of mild damage or 1 area of moderate damage (e.g., 2nd degree burn) are healed.
Caster is instantly awake from any unnatural sleep (e.g., Sleep spell, sleeping drug, etc.). Caster takes one round to awaken.
As Heal I, except caster can heal 5d10 concussion hits.
As Stun Relief I, except caster is relieved of 3 rounds accumulated stun effects.
As Stun Relief I, except caster is relieved of 3 rounds accumulated stun effects.
As Regenerate I, except 2 hits are healed every round.
As Frost/Burn Relief I, except the area(s) of damage that can be healed are: 5 mild and 1 severe or 1 mild and 2 moderate or 1 moderate and 1 severe or etc.
As Heal I, except caster can heal 10d10 concussion hits.
As Stun Relief I, except caster is relieved of 5 rounds accumulated stun effects.
As Regenerate I, except 3 hits are healed every round.
As Heal I, except caster can heal 15d10 concus- sion hits.
As Stun Relief I, except caster is relieved of 10 rounds accumulated stun effects.
As Heal I, except caster can heal 20d10 concus- sion hits.
As Heal I, except caster is healed of all concussion hits.
Caster is relieved of all burns and/ or frostbite
Caster is relieved of all accumulated stun effects.

Special Notes: When allowed to choose more than one option on summoning spells, the same option may be chosen more than once. For example, with a Animal Summons III, two options are available. This means that if both options are used for the same thing: that three first-level creatures could be summoned, or one third-level creature could be summoned, or one first-level creature could be summoned for four times as long.

Spells.Description: Puts any animal (i.e., non-humanoid) to sleep. Will not affect enchanted creatures or creatures with greater than animal intelligence.
Caster may heal any non-fatal damage in any animal up to 10 pounds in weight. Healing takes 6-600 minutes.
Allows caster to understand and ''speak'' the language of any 1 animal species.
As Animal Sleep I, except can put up to 3 animals to sleep.
Allows caster to control the actions of any 1 animal.
Caster can locate members of any 1 species of animal or he can find out what species are in the area.
All animals within 10' will act friendly toward caster. This spell does not control the animals.
As Animal Restoration I, except will affect an animal up to 150 pounds in weight, or an animal up to 10 pounds in weight can be healed of fatal damage (though not brought back from the dead).
Caster can understand and/or visualize the thoughts and emotions of any 1 animal.

Caster magically summons a 1st- level, non-intelligent creature from the surrounding area. The caster can specify the type of creature, but the GM should determine the type of creature that answers the summons. If the animal can understand the caster (e.g., Animal Tongues), the creature can be controlled through normal communication. Otherwise, control is maintained only through concentration of the caster. If the animal summoned is used for a task that is not dangerous (in its own perception), the duration for this spell is 10 minutes per level. However, if the animal is ever put into a dangerous situation, the duration immediately drops to 1 round per level.
As Animal Mastery I, except caster can control 3 animals.

As Animal Summons I, except caster can also choose two of the following options: a) the level of the summoned creature is increased by one, b) an extra 1st level creature can be summoned, or c) the duration can be doubled.
Caster can ''call'' any 1 known, specific animal. If it is physically possible, the animal will come to him.

Will return any animal up to 10 pounds in weight from the dead. The dead animal must make a roll (d100, open-ended) and add 2 times its previous level. There is an additional modifier of -2 per day that the animal was dead. If the result is over 100, the animal is returned from the dead. If the result is less than 100, the animal may not be returned from the dead by this caster (until the caster gains another level). The animal will be at -100 to all actions for a number of days equal to 20 days per day dead.

When cast upon any domesticated animal, that animal will return to its ''wild'' state. The animal will have no difficulty adapting to the harsh requirements of the wilder- ness (and have no desire to return to domestication).
As Animal Mastery I, except caster can control 5 animals.
As Animal Restoration I, except will affect an animal up to 3000 pounds in weight, or an animal up to 150 pounds in weight may be healed of fatal damage (though not brought back from the dead).
As Animal Summons II, except four options can be chosen.
As Animal Reviving I, except modifier is -1 for every two deads deady and there is no recovery time.
As Animal Summons II, except nine options may be chosen.
As Animal Mastery I, except caster can control all animals of a given species within 10'R per level.
As Animal Reviving III, except target is automatically brought back from the dead and there is no recovery period; and the range is 100'.
As Animal Summons I, except caster can select one option for every two levels of experience.

Special Notes: See Section 7.1.9 for more information on herbs and Herb Enhancement and Herb Mastery increasing the effectiveness of herbs.

Spells.Description: Caster can understand the nature, origin, and value of any 1 herb. If the plant is not an herb, no information will be gained.
Allows caster to enhance the potency of any 1 growing herb by 100\% (i.e., x2). This spell may be used only once per herb.
Allows caster to locate any 1 specific variety of herb that is sought, regardless of physical obstacles (gives exact direction, distance, and quantity).

Allows caster to make any 1 herb capable of being instantly effective. When the herb is subse- quently used, its benefits/dangers will be immediately felt. The herb will keep for 1 day per level of the caster.
Caster can double the potency of any 1 herb (growing or dead). This spell may be employed only once per herb. May not be combined with Herb Enhancement.
As Herb Finding I, except that the range is 300'.
Caster can grow an herb by planting the proper seed. The herb is sterile and the growth takes 1-10 rounds.
As Herb Mastery II, except potency is 3 times.
Allows caster to remove any harmful poisons, by-products, or side effects from all herbs within range.
As Herb Finding I, except range is 500'.
As Herb Mastery II, except potency is 5x.
As Herb Finding I, except range is 1 mile. Location is known within 10�R.
As Herb Mastery II, except potency is 10x.
As Instant Herbal Cures, except herb will keep for 1 week per level of the caster.
As Herb Finding I, except range is 5 miles. Location is known within 25'R.
As Herb Finding I, except range is 20 miles; location is known within 100'R.

As Enhancement, except that potency of 1 growing herb is increased 100\% x level of caster (e.g., a 30th level caster could increase the potency of a growing herb by 3000\% or 30 times its normal potency).

As Herb Mastery II, except that the potency fo 1 herb can be increased by 100\% x level of caster (e.g., a 50th level caster could increase the potency of any herb by 5000\% or 50 times its normal potency).
As Herb Finding I, except that caster can locate any 1 herb variety within a range of 1 mile per level of caster (e.g., 50 miles for a 50th level caster). Location is known within 100'R.

Special Notes: With the exception of Chameleon Skin, Lion Claws, and Viperfang, the caster does not physically change with any of the spells on this list.

Spells.Description: Caster moves as quietly as a cat. Adds +20 to all Stalking manuevers.

Caster's skin takes on the coloration of the surrounding terrain. Adds +10 to +50 to all Stalking/Hiding manuevers. As caster moves, coloration changes to match the surrounding terrain. This spell does not affect gear or clothing.

Caster gains an increased sense of smell and hearing (subtle smells and higher sonic ranges included). Adds +50 to Perceptions with only these senses; +20 to Perceptions using these sense combined with others.
Caster can run at two times normal pace (i.e., Run pace) and expend exhaustion points as if only walking.

Increases caster's ability to manuever without his sight. When blinded or otherwise without sight, this spell adds +10 to +50 to manuever rolls in the dark. Note that this spell does not negate penalties for blindness; it simply decreases them.
Caster can safely hold his breath for the duration of this spell.

Caster can glide like a bird. The product of the caster's altitude and horizontal speed cannot exceed 100' per round. For example, a caster can glide along at a rate of 5' per round if he were 20' off the ground; or he could glide at the rate of 50' per round if he were 2' off the ground. Note that the total must equal 100' (i.e., the caster cannot choose to have a total less than or more than 100').
Caster gains the visual acuity of a hawk. Adds +50 to all Perceptions involving only sight; +20 to all Perceptions involving this sense combined with others.
Caster's skin has the resilience of a large cat (effective AT of 3).
Caster gains the ferosity of a wild boar. He gains +20 to his melee OB, but cannot parry or use missiles for the duration of the spell.

Caster gains the ability to make claw attacks as a lion. He may attack using the Claw Attack Table (from Arms Law), with a maximum of Medium results. The caster must develop skill (i.e., an OB) with these claws (cost to develop is the same as Martial Arts Striking; stat modifiers are St/St/Ag).

Caster gains the vibratory sensitivity of an insect. He can sense vibrations in the ground (or other solid material) up to the area of effect. He will gain information indicating general movements and number of targets (�10\%). Treat as a +25 to +100 bonus to Perception (depending on the type of activity).
As Deer Speed I, except the speed increase is three times (i.e., Sprint pace).
Caster's skin has the resilience of a bear (effective AT of 8).

Caster gains the ability to make grapple attacks as a bear. He may attack using the Grapple Attack Table (from Arms Law), with a maximum of Medium results.The caster must develop skill (i.e., an OB) with this attack (cost to develop is the same as Martial Arts Sweeps/Throws; stat modifiers are St/St/Ag).
As Glide I, except product must equal 300'.

Caster gains the ability to make bite attacks as a serpent. He may attack using the Bite Attack Table (from Arms Law), with a maximum of Medium results. The caster must develop skill (i.e., an OB) with this attack (cost to develop is the same as Martial Arts Strikingp; stat modifier are St/Ag/Ag).
Caster's skin has the resilience of a minor drake (effective AT of 12).
As Deer Speed I, except the speed increase is four times (i.e., Fast Sprint pace).
Caster gains the strength of an ox. He gains a +40 melee OB, but cannot parry or use missiles for the duration of the spell.
As Glide I, except product must be 500'.
As Deer Speed I, except speed increase is five time (i.e., Dash pace).
Caster's skin takes on the resilience of a lesser drake (effective AT of 20).

Special Notes: See Section 7.1.27 for specific limitations on illusions (i.e., facades).
See Section 7.1.11 for specific rules on changing forms.
For the purposes of spells on this list, an animal is a creature that has no greater than animal intelligence.

Spells.Description: Caster studies and memorizes the form of one type of animal or plant for use with spells later on this list. The caster can only have as many forms studied as he has levels.

Caster is protected from natural heat up to 170 F and natural cold down to 20 F (treat as if target were in 70 F temperature). For temperatures above 170 F, subtract 100 F to determine the effective temperature for the caster. For temperatures below 20 F, add 50 F to determine the effect temperature for the caster. Caster also receives +20 to all RRs versus heat spells and heat attacks (+20 DB versus elemental fire and heat attacks); as well as +20 to all RRs versus cold spells and ice attacks (+20 DB versus elemental cold and ice attacks). The duration of this spell is 10 minutes per level if the caster does not move. If the caster moves, the spell will last as long as the caster concentrates.

Allows caster to take on the physical coloration of any 1 organic object. The caster must be in contact with object when the spell is cast. In many situations this will give a +10 to +50 bonus (GM's discretion) to Hiding attempts (and perhaps to some Stalking attempts).

Allows caster to appear as any one type of plant that he has studied. Caster retains his size and will not smell or feel like the plant (i.e., it is purely a visual illusion and is subject to normal illusion rules�see Section 7.1.27 for more on illusions).
Caster can move silently, so long as he does not create a sound originating more than 1' from his body.
Caster can breathe normally under water. This spell will not function with any liquid but water.

Allows caster to appear as any one type of animal that he has studied. Caster retains his size and will not smell or feel like the animal (i.e., it is purely a visual illusion and is subject to normal illusion rules�see Section 7.1.27 for more on illusions).
Caster and objects on his person appear to be a shadow; and thus are almost invisible in dark areas (e.g., in many situations this could be handled with a Stalking/Hiding bonus between +25 and +75).

Any single attack made against the caster this round suffers a -50 modifier. The weapon or object striking the caster must be from an organic source (i.e., an animal) or at least a partially organic weapon (i.e., an arrow).

Allows caster to take the form of any one plant he has studied. The caster will look and feel like the plant. He can vary his size from 75\% of normal to 200\% of normal. The caster does not gain the physical abilities of the plant. See Section 7.1.11 for more on changing forms.

Caster is protected from any natural heat and natural cold (treat as if target were in 70 F temperature). Caster also receives +40 to all RRs versus fire/ice spells, heat/cold attacks (+40 DB versus elemental attacks). The duration of this spell is 10 minutes per level if the caster does not move. If the caster moves, the spell will last as long as the caster concentrates.
For the duration of this spell, the caster's mental patterns will appear to be those of any animal he has studied. The caster cannot move while this spell is active.
As Shielding Organic I, except the penalty is -100.

Allows caster to take the form of any one animal he has studied. The caster will look and feel like the animal. He can vary his size from 75\% of normal to 200\% of normal. The caster does not gain the physical abilities of the animal. See Section 7.1.11 for more on changing forms.
As Animal Thoughts, except caster can move (though he must maintain concentration).
As Plant Form I, except caster may also assume the scent and physical abilities of the plant. Caster can vary his size from 50\% of normal to 400\% of normal.
As Animal Form I, except caster gains the movement abilities of the chosen animal. Caster can vary his size from 50\% of normal to 400\% of normal.
As Shielding Organic I, except attack automatically misses.
As Animal Form II, except caster gains the phsyical attacks of the animal. Caster can vary his size from 5\% of normal to 4000\% normal.
As Plant Form II, except the caster can change his form to any other plant he has studied at any time during the duration of the spell.
As Animal Form III, except the caster can change his form to any other animal he has studied at any time during the duration of the spell.
As Plant Form III and Animal Form III in operation at the same time.

Each round during the duration of the spell, the caster can negate (i.e., cause to miss) one attack directed at him. The attacking weapon must be at least part organic and he must be able to see the attack.

Special Notes: See Section 7.1.13 for more information about walls.

Spells.Description: Caster learns nature and history of any 1 plant
Allows caster to increase speed of growth for any 1 species of plant within the area of effect by 10 times.
Allows caster to understand and ''speak'' the language of any 1 plant species.
Heals damage to one plant that is less complex than a tree (especially severe damage may get a RR to avoid the effects of this spell, GM discretion).
As Speed Growth I, except growth rate is 100 times normal.
Caster can locate members of any 1 species of plant or he can find out what species are in the area of effect.
Allows caster to double the size of any 1 plant. The growth takes place over the course of 1 day.
Caster can control the automatic and/or mental processes of any 1 plant. The caster can also control the plant's movements, though this spell doesn't allow movement beyond normal allowances.
As Speed Growth I, except the area of effect is 100'R, and the range is 100'.
As Plant Growth I, except size increase is 3 times.
As Plant Control I, except caster can control any 3 plants.
As Plant Restore, except it can affect any plant (including trees).
As Plant Growth I, except size increase is 5 times.
As Speed Growth II, except the area of effect is 100'R and the range is 100'.
As Plant Control I, except caster can control any 5 plants.

Summons a wall of very tough (but pliable) thorns. The wall is up to 10' x 10' x 5'. Anyone moving through the wall receives d10 dagger attacks (use a +50 dagger attack on the Dagger Attack Table from Arms Law, if available) per foot of wall moved through. The wall must rest on a solid surface.
This spell will put out any fires upon living materials that are in the area of effect.
As Plant Growth I, except size increase is 10 times.
As Plant Growth I, except affects all plants in the area of effect.
As Speed Growth I, except for the range and area of effect.
As Plant Control I, except caster can control all plants within the area of effect.
Caster can animate any 1 plant. The plant can then move slowly, carrying any root system it may possess along.
